data.what_is:
Oracle Eloqua allow marketers to intrigue and win over audiences with personalized campaigns across multiple channels. Eloqua's marketer friendly platform equips marketing organizations with intelligent campaign management, flexible data management, accurate lead generation, and insightful sales enablement tools to engage buyers when they want to be engaged on their preferred channel.

Marketers use Oracle Eloqua to: 

*	Create sophisticated nurture experiences for adaptive journeys, at scale
*	Target and segment audiences using real-time data to create personalized experiences
*	Implement ABM strategies that engage, convert and expand target accounts 
*	Connect data from any system with an extensible, open framework 
*	Maintain clean and complete data across multiple regions and instances
data.product_description: Oracle's B2B Cross-Channel Marketing solution, Oracle Eloqua,  enables marketers to plan and execute automated marketing campaigns while delivering a personalized customer experience for their prospects.At Oracle, we believe that data is the most fundamental ingredient to success. Without a solid 'data-first' foundation, it's impossible to deliver a superior experience to customers. Oracle Eloqua provides marketers with the opportunity to connect data from multiple sources to ensure they are delivering targeted messages to customers at the precise moment they are looking to engage.Eloqua provides marketers an intuitive way to accurately identify and prioritize the best leads. Rather than using a points-based approach that can easily lead to false positives, Oracle evaluates each lead according to their percentage to ideal, based on any combination of profile and engagement criteria.Eloqua offers enterprise scalability that easily supports high volumes of contacts and leads that can be processed without data limitations. Oracle's open, flexible framework connects data from any system giving customers the functionality of real-time data flows that marketers can control and configure to their liking.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Based on 159 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 140 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: Based on 132 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 152 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 146 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 156 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Based on 101 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Based on 114 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Based on 152 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Based on 103 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Based on 382 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Based on 382 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Based on 371 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Based on 349 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Based on 220 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Based on 330 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Based on 316 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Based on 329 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Search Tracking and Optimization
features.content: Based on 286 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track performance of keywords and links in major search engines.  Measure search rankings and performance.  Improve page-level SEO with tools to diagnose and improve page performance.  Integrate with Google AdWords.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: Based on 208 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Based on 326 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Based on 346 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Based on 302 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Based on 323 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Based on 305 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Based on 294 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Based on 310 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Based on 318 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar. This feature was mentioned in 276 Oracle Eloqua reviews.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Based on 226 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: As reported in 190 Oracle Eloqua reviews. Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: Based on 157 Oracle Eloqua reviews. Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores.

features.name: Social Sharing
features.content: Based on 164 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Add intelligent social share buttons to your campaigns and content.  Track who is sharing your content and driving conversions.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: Based on 176 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: As reported in 167 Oracle Eloqua reviews. Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Based on 147 Oracle Eloqua reviews. Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: Based on 356 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Based on 295 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Based on 246 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: Based on 227 Oracle Eloqua reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: SEO / Keyword Analytics
features.content: As reported in 202 Oracle Eloqua reviews. Monitor and track how you rank for relevant keywords on major search engines and compare your overall performance to competitors.

initial_reviews.review_title: Incredible platform for B2B Marketing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
What I love about Oracle Eloqua is how it takes the guesswork out of marketing, it feels like having a personal assistant that knows exactly who to reach and when, also the way it personalizes messages makes campaigns feel more genuine and less like mass marketing. And as a plus, the insights it provides help me see what's working and what's not, so I'm always improving.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Sometimes crash so hard that nobody can explain why!!!

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Oracle Eloqua handles the tough parts of marketing--finding the right audience, personalizing messages, and tracking success.

initial_reviews.review_title: Customer Service perfection
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Customer Experience (CX) Cloud Suite?
The Oracle CX Cloud Suite enables businesses to gather and evaluate customer information from various sources, such as social media, email, and phone. This data can then be utilized to customize customer interactions, ensuring that clients receive relevant messages at optimal times.

What do you dislike about Oracle Customer Experience (CX) Cloud Suite?
Regarding customization, there has been frustration with the suite's limitations, as I feel that my specific needs and requirements cannot be adequately addressed by the suite's existing features and functionality.

What problems is Oracle Customer Experience (CX) Cloud Suite solving and how is that benefiting you?
Efficiency: The suite includes a range of tools for managing customer service interactions, such as chatbots, case management, and knowledge management. These tools can help businesses resolve customer issues quickly and efficiently.

initial_reviews.review_title: Oracle Eloqua review
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
For email design, templates and blocks can be pre-programmed, and then the creation of an email becomes a breeze. I also like how detailed the segmentation options are and the sending options from opt-in segments to shared lists that bypass opt-ins. We use those for mandatory standard or regulation change announcements.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is not intuitive and rather hard to learn. It is a tool that needs to be known and managed by dedicated IT specialists.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We do email marketing with Eloqua and segmenting our customer base for ABM purposes. It allows to send to hundreds and thousands of addresses and the campaigns can be timed, which is very productive.

initial_reviews.review_title: B2B enterprise marketing  automation that actually works out of the box, no developers needed.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Everything just works without the need of an army of developers to build and connect the various components needed in a successful multitouch campaign. I have used all of the top B2B Marketing automation platforms and this takes the cake. It truly has a well thought out and intuitive flow from creating segments and working with includes vs excludes, building out your email templates, landing pages and then there are the forms - the powerhouse of automation within... then you have the campaign canvas that ties in all of the workflows to whatever your marketers little heart desires. Things are easy to fix and move around and very visual for troubleshooting when things don't go as planned. The learning curve is short. I can get a user who has never touched any marketing automation tool sending out communications within an hour.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The bean counters in oracle thought they could get away with charging for education... so the talent pool is shallow, people either know it very well or just on the surface. They really should give their training for free. Even after 10 years of using the tool I am continuously learning new tricks...

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use eloqua for among many things, lead capture. The forms area is one of the most important areas for our enterprise. We also use it cor campaign attribution as it is one of the only platforms that can natively process all attribution with a built in campaign response hierarchy that triggers updates to the salesforce CRM. That helps us have full closes loop reporting when joining all responses with our opportunity closed/won data. No other tools really can do that... If you want attribution you really need to read in between the lines of what other tools can't do. SFMC doesnt even use the campaign object!

initial_reviews.review_title: "HOT CAKE IN MARKETING PERSONALLY RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS"
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The Oracle Eloqua is widely becoming a market leader in marketing now a days. We have been using this for more than two years and never got disappointed. We can easily target audiences from multiple channels. The language support is win - win  situation for Oracle Eloqua as none of their competitors are supporting a vast library of languages. The most important use of Oracle Eloqua is its automation abilities the whole process can be easily minimized using its automated functions. Email creation is super-duper easy and a lot of complicated functions can be done quickly.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The biggest disadvantage of Eloqua is it's not easy to learn for someone who is not an IT expert. It takes me like six months to fully teach them to my workers and adaption to Eloqua also takes time as we were using something else before using Eloqua. The interface and UI is very much boring it should be more attractive and smooth design. Other than this I didn't have any problems with Eloqua. They really need to improve in these areas.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall, a good software but they highly need to reduce their prices as their prices are much higher than their competitors. Its beneficial for small business and most of their clients are small business owners and for them its price tag is not budget friendly as compare to big business they can afford easily. They should really focus in these areas, overall, highly recommend it to others.

all_reviews.review_title: B2B enterprise marketing  automation that actually works out of the box, no developers needed.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Everything just works without the need of an army of developers to build and connect the various components needed in a successful multitouch campaign. I have used all of the top B2B Marketing automation platforms and this takes the cake. It truly has a well thought out and intuitive flow from creating segments and working with includes vs excludes, building out your email templates, landing pages and then there are the forms - the powerhouse of automation within... then you have the campaign canvas that ties in all of the workflows to whatever your marketers little heart desires. Things are easy to fix and move around and very visual for troubleshooting when things don't go as planned. The learning curve is short. I can get a user who has never touched any marketing automation tool sending out communications within an hour.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The bean counters in oracle thought they could get away with charging for education... so the talent pool is shallow, people either know it very well or just on the surface. They really should give their training for free. Even after 10 years of using the tool I am continuously learning new tricks...

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use eloqua for among many things, lead capture. The forms area is one of the most important areas for our enterprise. We also use it cor campaign attribution as it is one of the only platforms that can natively process all attribution with a built in campaign response hierarchy that triggers updates to the salesforce CRM. That helps us have full closes loop reporting when joining all responses with our opportunity closed/won data. No other tools really can do that... If you want attribution you really need to read in between the lines of what other tools can't do. SFMC doesnt even use the campaign object!

review_question_answers.answer: Everything just works without the need of an army of developers to build and connect the various components needed in a successful multitouch campaign. all_reviews.review_title: "HOT CAKE IN MARKETING PERSONALLY RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS"
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The Oracle Eloqua is widely becoming a market leader in marketing now a days. We have been using this for more than two years and never got disappointed. We can easily target audiences from multiple channels. The language support is win - win  situation for Oracle Eloqua as none of their competitors are supporting a vast library of languages. The most important use of Oracle Eloqua is its automation abilities the whole process can be easily minimized using its automated functions. Email creation is super-duper easy and a lot of complicated functions can be done quickly.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The biggest disadvantage of Eloqua is it's not easy to learn for someone who is not an IT expert. It takes me like six months to fully teach them to my workers and adaption to Eloqua also takes time as we were using something else before using Eloqua. The interface and UI is very much boring it should be more attractive and smooth design. Other than this I didn't have any problems with Eloqua. They really need to improve in these areas.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall, a good software but they highly need to reduce their prices as their prices are much higher than their competitors. Its beneficial for small business and most of their clients are small business owners and for them its price tag is not budget friendly as compare to big business they can afford easily. They should really focus in these areas, overall, highly recommend it to others.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is a very capable and robust solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The automation and API capabilities are very robust and powerful. You can set up a lot of complicated programs that others cannot. It's also easy to modify programs while active and see where contacts fall in each step. Lead scoring has multiple levels allowing you to really zero in on a good scoring strategy to move contacts through the marketing funnel and serve up good leads to sales.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Some components have outdated UI. The email composer has some flaws too. The segmentation functions could be a little more intuitive, I feel like other platforms have this component fleshed out a bit more. However, it's more of a learning curve than anything. The asset library feels a little clunky and dated from a UI perspective, it would be nice if this function as a bit smoother of an experience. From an administrator perspective, I would like to see more detail on user activity for audits. On the same token, I feel like the contact records could be presented in a more visually appealing way. As you could probably tell, the theme here is that it's a great system with a lackluster UI. Oracle could improve the system a thousand fold if they invested in a better UI/UX for the platform, which is it's main limitation.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would recommend this product for more intermediate and advanced marketing automation professionals. New users can onboard with relative ease for components such as email and landing page configuration.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation - Multiple users with different security groups serving different functions can all operate efficiently off one platform. We also use the program to build out forms and secure landing pages.

all_reviews.review_title: Good but there are better options for the price
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Easy to administrate and teach marketing users how to use the platform. This is due to the easy drag and drop nature of the email, segment, landing page, form and campaign builders.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Price ... quite expensive for what it is and all third party integrations increase this cost substantially. There are also some tools that give much greater email customisation with drag and drop that does not require technical skills.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Take into consideration the skill level of your users. If you would like an easy to learn tool that doesn't require too much admin input on marketing campaigns after staff training, this may be the platform for you. However, the price point is a major hurdle to get past. If you use Salesforce as your CRM it would be best to look at Marketing Cloud or Pardot as well, the choice will depend on the skill level of your users.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua allowed us to use a marketing automation tool at all levels of our business and independent of the technical skills of a user. Whether this was through Eloqua Engage within Salesforce for sales staff to use or for full time marketers within the platform itself. The landing page builder also allowed our web devs the opportunity to completely code pages and password protect which was something that they were not able to do within our CMS.

Due

all_reviews.review_title: Great for Big Corporations with Big Marketing Departments
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle Eloqua is extremely powerful and most importantly can handle millions of records. There's not much you can't do in Eloqua in terms of marketing campaigns.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
What I disliked about my time with Eloqua was its reliability. There would be situations where it wouldn't always update to salesforce properly or a campaign would be fully activated. It took an entire department and more to get Eloqua fully optimized for what we needed it for. So the barrier for entry to get it all set up to begin with I'm sure is worse than many other marketing automation platforms.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would make sure you look at what your company needs. I believe other platforms like Hubspot can do almost as much if not more. But not many applications can handle millions of records as Eloqua can.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of the problems I had when I was using Eloqua was making sure integration time between Salesforce and Eloqua was as fast as possible and data connected perfectly. I realized after I stopped using Eloqua and instead used other platforms with different organizations since is Eloqua was incredibly powerful. Being able to create forms within Eloqua and easily capture all data needed is something many organizations still have trouble doing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I liked the ability to see email sends and click opens.It boosted the confidence of our reps and allowed us to track efficiently. Being able to show the reps in sales force that marketing also sent emails and scores with chili peppers and stars was very helpful for them in follow up. The upsides are that it empowers our sales reps to micro market for themselves, in addition to our own macro marketing.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Running reports wasn't my favorite task. It also wasn't as user friendly as marketo that we used to use. It worked with our oracle platform and sales force but wasn't as powerful as others we had used. It took a little while for us to get used to (as with any new platform) but the algorithm it uses for lead tracking is sound and it was good for our reps to see the stats when a cold lead turns into a warm lead.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Communicating and micro marketing to clients using sales reps. Sales reps are more confident especially when templates are created. The scores were difficult to understand and communicate to the reps. all_reviews.review_title: Complex system for complex marketing automation needs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The system is incredibly customizable for just about any marketing automation you need to do, including non-email channels. It's great for campaigns with multiple steps, and works well with a proper Salesforce CRM integration for delivering MQLs to sales teams.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
It should not be used with a unique identifier that is not email address. The "guts" of the system are not built for that, and it creates a situation where workarounds and glitches become the norm. Also, their tech support is terrible, and training that's worthwhile is very expensive. Documentation is lackluster but getting better. The platform itself is also quite costly for what you get compared to other similar platforms.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Stick to email address as the unique identifier and make sure your CRM integration is done well. Hire a consultant if you can, as implementation is not as simple as a standard email platform.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've developed complex, multi-step, and multi-channel marketing campaigns that allow us to speak to customers who have and do not have an email address on file. This enhanced our marketing campaigns over the last 6 years. However, after 6 years, we are still struggling to see ROI because of the complexity of the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Oracle Eloqua returns your money if used efficiently and negotiated wisely.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
It is efficient and powerful.
Eloqua has good features to integrate with all types of lead sources and collate all leads. This is very important so that you are able to implement common automations and effectively utilise all leads.

Further target the leads and for drip campaigns.
Drips can be setup and automated using easy to define rules and scenarios. And basis reactions the further steps are strategised and implemented.
Goals can be setup and viewed if they are being achieved.

The lead scoring methodology is quite effective.
The lead scoring has very simple and logical definition. Simple steps and rules can be defined and 3X3 grid if lead scoring can be created.
You may setup up further automatic steps basis lead scoring achieved.

Easy to export and import data.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
You need to negotiate for long term and for incremental lead base. Your lead base increases with time and thus you need to plan for future. As in general rate of increase of leads is higher than the rate by which you exclude them. Thus your lead base grows by the years.

Commercials are basis leadbase consumed per annum. Thus you may want to negotiate a multi-year deal with higher volumes every year.

They have slabs for lead volumes and incremental costs are much higher.
Thus the requirement of plan long term and negotiate for higher volumes.

Else renewals make it too costly and sometimes make it a drain rather than a gain.

It can be more user friendly, the user interface and how you are able to visualise the drips can be improved.

It has good variety of integrations which are possible. The integrated is also suggested and arranged if required. But setup and integration is a time consuming task.

There is interaction required with your lead source providers and managers and the integrator.

In addition, the use case and the purpose for the use has to be clearly defined in the onset so that the integrator can design the process and make it useful.
There are 3rd party solution providers available but it is difficult to sign up with them.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
This is very powerful and a long term commitment. If you have been using another marketing automation platform then you understand the power. Define your use cases properly with definitive goals and steps to achievement. This will make the process easier and smooth. You will be able to achieve your goals and measure success and track ROI.

It you are new to automation then take some time to analyse what you want and you may seek help in defining the targets.

Commit to it for long term though you can achieve results immediately. The efforts required to integrate justifies in long term.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead scoring
Lead scoring methodology is very good and effective. Easy easy to setup which is generally not the case otherwise.

Lead nurturing
Lead nurturing to increase lead scores. flexible drip campaigns can be set up and used to provide enalitiks downloadables and  information to leads basis their past actions. Thereby increasing the lead score.

Dead Leads
Revive dead leads through effective lead nurturing campaigns and automate processes to bring the leads in the refreshed pool.

ROI
This can definitely give yours moneys worth and more. 20% -30% increase in efficiency per traditional methods has been achieved.

all_reviews.review_title: Gives us actionable data with superb automated functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
What I like most about Eloqua is the ease that a Campaign can be configured on the Campaign screen. Eloqua has a user-friendly interface and lets you quickly set up a campaign with just a few clicks. It has a wide affluence and a perfect interaction between the components that the tool has, shape, segments, everything joins and connects in Canvas. The way it allows you to create advanced, highly customized campaign products is perfect.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle Eloqua doesn't have a lot of support for developers to customize how companies use it. I would love the ability to build my own code module library for emails and still use it within their WYSIWYG email editor.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Take advantage of all of the education resources available to you in Oracle Eloqua and purchase the Education Pass. It's an investment in your career and your company.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have benefited from the campaign canvas in Eloqua because it gives me visibility into my marketing automations -- I have a clear visual representation of what is happening to my leads and where my gaps are. I also have benefited from the Education Pass and the education resources that are available to me through it. Eloqua has the best education of any marketing automation software I've used. The lead scoring models are very easy to build and offer a good amount of flexibility. With some additional enhancements lead scoring could provide even more flexibility.

It has a wide affluence and a perfect interaction between the components that the tool has, shape, segments, everything joins and connects in Canvas. all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is a great platform for those who are new to the marketing game, and those who have been in the game for a long time and would like to step it up. There is a ton of functionality and it allows you to expand your strategy and ideas without needing to invest in other softwares too much. The intricacies of Eloqua are amazing and can basically be a CRM System for us without having an actual CRM system. It can be both the marketing team and the sales team all in one.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is not the easiest system to learn. It takes some times to figure out and train new team members on how to use the system well. It also is a system that takes a lot of time to configure correctly, especially if someone set it up without fully knowing what they were doing

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Oracle Eloqua is a very robust system that takes a lot of time to get right. My company has been using it for well over 5 years and we are again just now scratching the surface of what the system can do. Take your time in learning because it is easy to start, and can take a long time to really get to a place of having full mastery of the product. But that is okay. Also, unless you have never done marketing before, do not get an Oracle University Subscription. Just talk to other users of the product.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Oracle Eloqua to automate our email marketing campaigns. As well as venture into nurture campaigns for our current contacts. It has been really helpful in creating dynamic campaigns that will allow us to continue to grow our support and contact loyalty.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to learn, but interface needs updating
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I like the fact that Eloqua is quite easy to learn how to use, and the campaign canvas is great and allows you to easily lay out complex campaigns in a visual way so you can keep track of all the connections between the different campaign components, e.g. segments, emails, forms, non-opener follow ups, different pathways, etc. Reporting can be powerful once you know how to use it, and some very helpful reports are available out of box, so you don't have to build everything from scratch to start pulling statistics about your communications. Navigation is simple as everything is well labelled in the menu sections, and day-to-day usage is quickly picked up.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The user interface feels quite dated, and most of it is in dull shades of grey, so it might be nice to have it more modernised. There is no optimization for mobile, which in some ways is understandable as you can do some complex things, but it may be handy to have a mobile version which offers the ability to quickly deactivate a campaign in an emergency. Also it lacks the ability to natively integrate with other systems, e.g. CRM or external reporting, meaning you may need middleware to achieve this, or go through cumbersome processes if you need multiple systems to communicate with each other.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
My company is using Eloqua to send all internal and external email campaigns as we are able to track opens, click-throughs, everything, and can then make improvements based on the indications of this data, e.g. we can see which email addresses are effective, what kind of subjects lines are more appealing, and what kinds of emails are more successful. We can also use Eloqua for customer satisfaction surveys, as it can host pages as well as send emails, and it also connects with our website forms so that new leads are added to our database and added to nurture tracks. We are also using it to help us manage our subscription center and record subscription and unsubcriptions easily, and help keep our customer database recent, relevant and up-to-date.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is robust and does more or less what it promises. It has all the basic email marketing automation tools, as well as lead qualification etc.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The software is just extremely buggy, insanely unintuitive and not userfriendly. It does not lead the user easily through the email campaign process but expects the user to know what they want - and you must do it in one, specific (illogical-)Eloqua-way. I dont personally like the user interface, which is old-fashioned and engineering style. Looks like it was coded in the beginning of 2000s and never updated afterwards. The user experience follows the same pattern, as there are many illogical steps one has to do, which are simply not acceptable for a software in 2020. For example, Eloqua does not remember in which folder you were before you opened the email draft or campaign draft, and when you go back you have to start the path to the right folder from the scratch. It does not have any autosave, so you have to remember to save everything you were doing every few minutes. Because if you don't, some bug (which are common) probably strikes on the way and wipes out everything you were doing. I can't recommend this software, there are so many more user friendly, modern and cheaper options available.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Probably suitable if you like old and engineer-styled software and are ready to big penny for it. If you need something flexible, agile and modern, do not bother.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Eloqua mainly for email marketing automation, which it does - but in a slow, unintuitive and demanding manner.

It is web/cloud based platform that offers wide range of functions.  It keeps in view the marketing of your company and by email marketing it makes newsletter. It integrates well with social media and with the help of it data is easily exported. It makes email campaigns and landing pages easy and integrates with other applications as well.

The UI needs to be more better. It is difficult to learn and takes a lot of time. There is no free trial and no free version available.

all_reviews.review_title: Support all our marketing-related activities with Eloqua
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
With Oracle Eloqua it greatly facilitates the process of creating forms, dramatically reducing the processing, campaign design and segmentation steps. Before, these processes had to be done manually and with isolated software, but Eloqua allows us to do everything from the same platform. The Insight tool is one of the best, as it gives us details about the success of our campaign and also gives practical advice to improve our future campaigns.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
To be able to use the tools of Oracle Eloqua it is necessary to have a certificate approved by Eloqua. This process is not only complex, but long, overwhelming and, honestly, unnecessary. I also think that the functions of the Toolbox could improve. Perhaps if they were simplified a bit they would be easier to implement with text functions. With regard to designs, they could also facilitate the processes of changing colors and editing invitation messages.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Overall, Oracle Eloqua is a very robust and customizable tool. It has many aspects that I like, such as landing page design, lead configuration and process automation, which provides real-time tracking. In addition, Eloqua allows integration with CRM software, which maximizes its reach even further and expands its power. The technical support is excellent! Able to solve complex problems and offer customization for various tools.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
At first, Oracle Eloqua is a bit of a check and doesn't really have an instruction manual to follow as a guide. Adding these instructions would be very useful. When it comes to establishing a connection between contacts and companies, it is based solely on Salesforce contacts, which creates a certain dependence on Eloqua with another platform and limits, in a certain way, the freedom of the product.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Oracle Eloqua is a recommended tool for marketing and sales teams that seek to scale and better understand their customers.

Its system of automation of communications with potential clients has been a great help to perform in the market much faster. In addition, it allows us to make sure that all the content we send is relevant to our customers. Oracle Eloqua allows us to rate and automate the process of interaction with our online contacts.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Bachelor of Science - BS, Computer Science

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
This is a very powerful tool when it comes to ETL, lead routing, data cleansing and standardization. When it coems to Eloqua WYSIWYG improvements, then they seem to continue to get better as well. This tool has lots of flexibility with segmenting and contacts, and it is also very easy to create emails and landing pages, visual layouts of campaign workflows. What is even better, it comes with a lot of various email statistic reports.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There are just a few things that seemed to be more difficult than they should be. For example, not being able to create a picklist on the go within a form, or you just need to create a separate header each time if you wanted to use it for preview text. Once in a while it seemed to glitch and I'd need to "Save As" and try again to get it to work. Some of the customizable reports are clunky to build and take forever to load. There are even times when there is "too much" data to load a report!

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Great marketing automation tool.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Visualisation, segmenting of contacts, email campaigns

all_reviews.review_title: Sophisticated capabilities but steep learning curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua has so many possibilities for personalisation. The features can target different audiences using sophisticated filters or if-this-than-that logic so that the potential of a single email can be maximised.The newest design templates have much more customisation that are easier for marketers with less digital experience to use.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Unless you're specialising in digital marketing or email campaign management, most marketers wouldn't be able to manage an email campaign end-to-end. At my firm, although I have a moderate  knowledge of the system, we have an email automation team to build our campaigns once we've given them the different components. There needs to be a strong investment of time to gain an average knowledge for general use.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua connects well with Salesforce as a CRM and we are looking to enhance the automation and communication between the two.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
What I really like about Oracle Eloqua is its powerful functions and features, such as its detailed segmentation that uses contact attributes, its high level of complementation with other systems. In addition to being able to work with a centralized database, it allows me to control who can access and which contacts. Its progressive and responsive design capabilities make it easy to design on the fly or make changes without having to have a designer code every time.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I consider that it presents a somewhat old system, so it could make it a bit cumbersome to get basic concepts. I really don't like how scattered all the steps are to send an email.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
As far as I am concerned, Oracle Eloqua is the recommended software if you need a large-scale marketing automation platform having a team a team with the ability, size and knowledge base to be able to implement it correctly, it can also be integrated with a Associated software to do the things that Eloqua cannot do. Very ideal for professionals and marketing companies, being the most robust solution in the market due to its great flexibility in terms of customization. It is impossible not to recommend it.

Currently we use Oracle Eloqua for the management and processing of potential customer data so Eloqua helps us solve it, currently this tool is used by our organization for general reports, some departments within the organization use it to create their own emails electronic, but it is also implemented to support the marketing department.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Marketing Technology Director - B2B Marketing Agency of the Year 2019

all_reviews.review_title: Very complete, but you have to learn it first
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
- New Email/Landing Page editor fully responsive
- Drag & Drop Campaign Canvas
- Very simple Automated Programs even for who doesn't have IT skills
- Lead Scoring
- Very complete and customizable reports and dashboards

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
- Full Integration: you have to hire a system integrator agency to do that or have a very skilled IT team. Could require several months.
- Cross Channel Tracking: if users switch between Desktop Computers, Tablets and Smartphone (like they do a lot) Eloqua often fails to recognize all the touchpoints and the complete user behaviour
- Website Analytics: while other Eloqua reports are very complete, the Website Analytics is basic. It's better to setup automatic link parameters inside the platform settings and use a professional website analytics tool.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Before getting started you have to follow Oracle training webinars or subscribe to an Oracle Eloqua Bootcamp. Read every guide you can find. Subscribe to Topliners (Oracle's community) and don't worry of asking questions there. Search for an Oracle Gold / Diamond Partner that can handle an Eloqua Training. The platform has a lot of solutions, features and options. If you start working on it without knowing anything could be very difficult to understand.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a B2B business using Eloqua mostly for generating new clients. We generated new leads with very simple landing pages with forms then, thanks to the complete lead scoring system, we improved their conversion to prospects or to clients. Not just automation: our salesman can send personal emails to a single client with Oracle Engage, knowing their previous behaviours and their current lead score.

all_reviews.review_title: Good for landing pages in the marketing campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle Eloqua allows you to work with a central database, making very effective the analysis and reports that will come after it. This has represented a significance improvement in our work. But its biggest strength definitely is their support, as it's offered by the same community of Oracle Eloqua users. It's almost sure you will find all the help you need in forums, with so many users that have so much experience with these tools.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Once you have built your page, there's not an option that allows you to convert the page to HTML. In order to do this, it requires additional tools.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Oracle Eloqua is a great tool and I think it will be a great fit for experienced users. However, it tends to be frustrating for beginners (I have experienced this), and they will hardly get to use all the tools it offers. If you want to implement this tool in your company, make sure you can count with some experienced users that can train to the rest of the team.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Oracle Eloqua is used in the Marketing department on daily basis. It's especially useful when we're trying to create landing pages for the marketing campaigns in our website or through email with our customers. It provides enough information to ensure the data we're receiving is clean. Besides, it shows an overview of the content that's delivered to our audience and the level of relevance it has reached.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer: Oracle Eloqua allows you to work with a central database, making very effective the analysis and reports that will come after it. This has represented a significance improvement in our work. But its biggest strength definitely is their support, as it's offered by the same community of Oracle Eloqua users. It's almost sure you will find all the help you need in forums, with so many users that have so much experience with these tools.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer: Once you have built your page, there's not an option that allows you to convert the page to HTML. In order to do this, it requires additional tools.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
review_question_answers.answer: Oracle Eloqua is a great tool and I think it will be a great fit for experienced users. However, it tends to be frustrating for beginners (I have experienced this), and they will hardly get to use all the tools it offers. If you want to implement this tool in your company, make sure you can count with some experienced users that can train to the rest of the team.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Oracle Eloqua is used in the Marketing department on daily basis. It's especially useful when we're trying to create landing pages for the marketing campaigns in our website or through email with our customers. It provides enough information to ensure the data we're receiving is clean. Besides, it shows an overview of the content that's delivered to our audience and the level of relevance it has reached.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle Eloqua was a great platform to start my career with. The complexities of it actually paid off later down the road and made me understand email at a deeper level. I thought creating segments was very easy as well as creating triggered campaign series. The other thing I enjoyed about the platform was its user friendly interface.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
However, with all the new technology out there I think Eloqua has alot of catching up to do. Most platforms now have predictive anlaytics, drag and drop email builders, and more. I feel Eloqua has alot of technology catchup to do. Also the platform always was slow with bigger data sets, as well as crashed much too often for our liking. Overall just experienced better platforms in my years of email.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
This is a self service platform! If you are a smaller company or a startup I would not recommend this platform as their level of support was not great and we had alot of overall issues with the platform they could not solve for.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Execute campaigns for our clients, execute large trigger campaigns for our clients, easy to use internally to work efficiently and onboard new employees quickly

all_reviews.review_title: Oracle Eloqua is integrated with many business systems.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle Eloqua is a marketing automation solution for B2B marketers to track customers through all phases of the purchase cycle. Marketing professionals can create targeted campaigns across multiple channels, such as email, social networks, mobile, web and search. They can also track and analyze the results of their campaigns with integrated analytical tools.
Marketing professionals can create dynamic shopping cycle paths using the drag-and-drop interface in the Campaign Canvas. They can also monitor the tasks related to different campaigns from the control panel.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Like other Oracle products, there may be a long implementation process, specifically when complex software customization can be involved.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I can recommend Oracle Eloqua as it integrates with many business systems, such as customer relationship management (CRM) and other third-party applications. This is due to the Oracle partner network of more than 500 suppliers, which allows companies to integrate any of the 700 applications. And since Oracle Eloqua is part of the Oracle Marketing Cloud framework, customers can integrate other applications within that framework, such as Oracle Social Cloud, Oracle Content Marketing, Oracle Content and Experience and Oracle Service Cloud.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Oracle Eloqua's sales enablement features currently allow my company and the sales and marketing teams to work together to obtain new customers and revenues. Sales representatives can access more detailed information about the potential customer (such as the web or social activity) and send targeted emails that are tracked to help close the deal faster. The Oracle Eloqua sales enablement features are available through a Microsoft Outlook add-on or through the CRM. Now there are additional extensibility options available to connect your LinkedIn, Mintigo, PathFactory and Demandbase accounts to Profiler for an even wider view of each contact

all_reviews.review_title: The cream of the crop for Marketing Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Setting up campaigns will not be more simplistic than in Eloqua. The feasibility to reach your prospects or leads through a variety of channels in a drag-and-drop canvas cannot be understated enough. The reporting is far superior to Marketo, or any other tools I have used. You can get as granular with the data as you want. It easily connects and integrates with other systems, so our developers have enjoyed using it in a more technical fashion. Landing pages and forms are very easy to set up as well. The tool continues to evolve and bring more advanced capabilities to any marketing team.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
As B2B marketing becomes more account focused, I think Eloqua needs to evolve in the same way and provide more accessible account analytics and overview. This will help marketers and sales teams.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
If you want to take personalized campaigns to the next level, and have resources from a funding and technical standpoint, Eloqua is the best option on the market and it's not close.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are now speaking to people about what they want to hear about, and when they want to hear from us using Oracle's STO feature. The reporting gives me tremendous insight into who our sales folks should be focusing on, along with B2C opportunities and content creation opportunities. The benefits are endless if the tool is used properly, but the ability to efficiently reach thousands of prospects and understand their digital behavior is the biggest benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: It integrates with the Oracle database

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is a fantastic and quite robust marketing automation tool. It has effectively integrated with our CRM System, Salesforce. You can pull reports, gather customer buying journey data, develop content for specific departments within the company, and assign users access to that content.

Lead scoring and nurturing capabilities in Eloqua are a premium feature of this tool, in my opinion. The lead scoring options are vast, so you can ensure that your marketing qualified leads are indeed qualified.

The largest benefit for my team is the ability to designate levels of accessibility for different groups. We have a marketing operations department that builds the templates, manages distribution lists, and develops automated programs. Marketing specialists do not have access to those features but can easily pull reports on their campaigns without having to go into the back-end of the system. Our salespeople can access Eloqua Engage right from our CRM, so they can use readily-available and approved templates at their convenience without having to request anything from marketing.

The landing page customizability was an important feature for our team. We want our landing pages to look professional, and other systems we have used don't offer the level of quality we're looking for. Eloqua has templates you can choose from, but the level of customization is unparalleled. Our operations team can quickly design a landing page that is professional-grade.
If we have run into any issues, we're able to contact support and quickly come up with a solution. The Eloqua support team is knowledgeable, responsive, and helpful.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
To build templates, you should have a steady working knowledge of HTML coding. I do not, so I have to rely on others to create the templates I need. For my team, this is an extreme bottleneck. I have to wait on the one person who is capable of building templates in an HTML format. If you are not a fluent coder, this may not be the best tool for you. However, if you do have extensive HTML knowledge, you may enjoy this tool.

Even my experienced coder has issues writing code within the tool- often they have to do so in a separate application and paste it into Eloqua's system.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
If you are a medium or large organization with a need for a heavy-duty marketing tool, Eloqua is a great system to use. You will need someone with coding experience to optimize the use of this tool. Eloqua is expensive, so I recommend that you assure the cost doesn't outweigh the benefits.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our previous system did not natively integrate with our CRM, causing issues with syncing and data integrity. Eloqua seamlessly connects to Salesforce, so we are able to pull reports and gather metrics with a few clicks. The Eloqua Engage add-on allows our salespeople to access the templates we build without having to request them from us. We simply create and share the template to Engage, and the sales team has their own autonomy with 1-1 communication.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua allows you to utilize their industry-forward email, landing page and segmentation building applications to create a full-service system to reach your customers. They have stylized, responsive and overall smart ways to build everything you need to start and complete a customer's journey including the ability to download additional apps into its ecosystem and even connect it external applications such as Litmus.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
They tend to truncate asset names in the campaign builders which are very crucial to putting together/organizing my campaign canvas. You don't want to send the wrong version of an email to the wrong segment, which can very easily happen if you're not careful to check your asset names. It can also be a little slow in the general navigation but I feel it has only gotten better/speedier with every update.

Also, the apps that are available for it leave me wanting a lot more, especially when it comes to responsiveness. Their responsive email editor is relatively new as well and while it's been a pleasure to work in, it leaves me wanting more as well and I find myself editing a lot of the modules with custom coding instead of the leave-it-to-us offerings that Eloqua has provided me to work with. I'm fairly advanced in my HTML+CSS and love the ability to skirt past the full-blown need to code but some of the "responsive modules" are not as responsive as they claim to be.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Organize your asset names and file/folder directory, assets can and will add up fast and you'll want an organized look.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua offers users the ability to take advantage of 'dynamic content' which allows me to create a multitude of email variations in just one email. By defining our contacts within a segment with standardized variables, we can create multiple personas which we then direct Eloqua to send specific portions of emails that display different content based on the user's persona. It doesn't allow clickthrough tracking in the dynamic content.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The WYSIWYG canvases make non-technical usage easy. The ability to monitor the content of a segment population as you create it is great for quality control.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua assumes contacts are unique on a per-email basis and does not have a concept of a target customer having multiple simultaneous emails. There is no ability to merge contacts in a way that retains the history of all merged contacts. There are significant limitations in how complex a "join" between contacts and supplemental custom data objects can be. Email content that requires variable length lists (say a list of products purchased) is not strictly possible.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Figure out your data model plan ahead of time in light of oracles segment creation limitations. Make sure the notion of email/customer uniqueness is not a huge challenge for your business.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Avoiding using large amounts of human resources to send marketing.

Implementation has been very challenging due to the problems above so benefits have been slim so far. We hope to resolve some of those challenges with the help of 3rd party developers.

all_reviews.review_title: Mostly positive with room for improvement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The ease of use and the clean UI. It makes the system easier for new users and for individuals who cannot code, and the regular rollout of new features is exciting.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The limitations of the WYSIWYG editor for emails. You can preview a live email to see how your end user would see it, but you cannot test any unique links or buttons in that message for testing purposes. Seems like a strange limitation, and since we're currently migrating our Demand Gen team over from Marketo we realized that they used to have that ability and will lose it with Eloqua.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We;re attempting to understand more about how our homeowners would like to be communicated with, and also determine whether our email marketing team should be focusing mostly on remarketing or instead focusing on creating the best homeowner experience. Ideally we would be doing both, but we want to be sure we're not cannibalizing our efforts by splitting that focus.

all_reviews.review_title: Migration from Marketo was the right choice
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Visual campaign designer is a vast improvement from our previous provider. We are a small team of creative people, not engineers.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
We are still relatively new to Eloqua and haven't encountered much not to like. One roadblock for us, though, was figuring out how to embed forms in our existing B2B website in WordPress. We did have to have our development agency spend a few hours restyling our style sheets to handle eloqua forms. I also wish there were better, full-width designs for landing pages.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Again, still relatively new, but we in the publishing business are faced with a massive transformation in how we position ourselves to customers as more than just sellers of commoditized ads. We rely on Eloqua tools integrated with our website to engage more with our clients and prospects to guide them toward learning more about our capabilities as a marketing partner.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Ease of use in building campaign assets.  Its relatively easy to on-board new users and then increase their skills.  The new responsive editors are easy to use and do not require the knowledge of HTML.  The new apps that are launced enable users to really leaverage the platform for more advanced usage.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Some of the documentation and help guides on the more advances features are less than helpful at times.  The information needs to go a bit further to truly help the user.

Also having to wait for more advanced features when the new repsonive editors have rolled out have kept us from fully adopting the new editors.  We are fairly advanced in what we produce and we're not able to make the switch to the new features immediately.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Consistent naming convention in all your assets is important.  Also, think about security groups if you have different levels of users accessing the platform.  This will help to prevent messages going out to the wrong audience.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead generation and lead nurturing while staying compliant with regulations.  Tracking campaign effectiveness and the ability to drive pipeline revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: A powerful tool but to complicated to setup
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
How flexible and customizable it is. If you have already used other Marketing Automation tools and know what they are capable of doing, you can go crazy with Eloqua with their powerful segmentations and automated campaigns that allows users to create flows with differente data points, conditionals and actions. If you have technical support there are things you can customize that work deep in the system.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Poor UX and UI. Terrible design. It looks like it never left the early 2000's type of software. Usually enterprise software looks terrible, with Eloqua is no different than that.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
There are lots of tools nowadays. Some are way cheaper, easy to use and as powerful as Eloqua. But if you are a big company that needs lots of customization you might benefit from Eloqua. You also might need a robust tool like Eloqua if you work with a huge database of contacts. They handle massive contact lists and email sending really well.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
I used Oracle Eloqua as our main Marketing Automation tool to sync marketing and sales efforts and data. We had Salesforce integrated with Eloqua so we could leverage data from both tools to create powerful campaigns. It helped me to automatically segment and nurture leads by combining their powerful segmentation and automations.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Digital Marketing Analyst - Blackboard / Rosetta Stone

all_reviews.review_title: Oracle Eloqua - Email Personalization Made  Simple
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua took me a year to fully learn but it is now easy to use. It allows me to highly segment customer lists and create dynamic content in order to make emails highly personalized and targeted. I like that there are Shared Lists and Shared Filters; it saves a lot of time. I like that I can build forms, and landing pages all within the same product. Support Help is very helpful and has solved all issues I have found so far. If I ever have a problem, they usually roll out an update that fixes it soon afterwards. I love that forms are now drag and drop.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I did not know how to code and I have to code to use it, and that took some time to learn. I had a coworker teach me, otherwise I don't know that I would love it. We don't have much customer support for learning besides if we have a specific issue that is happening.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Emailing several contacts at the same time in one go, with personalized content to each contact. For instance, our ticketing emails can be easily built to exclude people who already have the plan advertised, without having to pull a csv file from a different CRM system.

I like how easy it is to view all templates and previously sent emails. I've used other tools that make it difficult to create/use templates.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I dislike how scattered all the steps to send an email are. I feel like you have to go over here to create your email, over here to make your recipient list and over there to send the email.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I'm a sales executive so I like the ability to quickly send out an "customized" e-mail regarding a specific targeted market or solution set that I offer and it's integrated directly into Salesforce.com, my CRM tool.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Make sure you clear spell out your "assets" when setting up your campaigns or else you could have overlap or get things mixed up and not have any indication of it happening until it's "after the fact" and already went out to the prospect.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Trying to reach a large targeted prospect group and have the ability to customize the look and feel of the e-mails that go out. I also like that you can choose to send out multiple templates or variations to the same prospect based on their personas.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Ease of use; very clearly defined actions when building out a campaign through the campaign canvas.  The fact that you can visualize the flow of a marketing campaign is very helpful.  Everything else is also easy to use until you get to the back-end.  But as it with sophisticated system I understand there's a learning aspect, which I can appreciate.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I dislike custom data objects (data card sets).  It seems a bit hard to navigate intuitively but like I said previously, you need to spend some time learning.  It would be great if there were more free usability videos to get a faster understanding.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using it to help determine and score our leads through behaviour of our prospects.  Then able to build out email marketing campaigns based on their activity with our collateral.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The customization for email templates is good, it is easy to create new distribution lists to send to, and the sending process is simple. It has the ability to schedule emails, which is a great feature. It also hosts documents and photos, and has solid analytics.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
While you can customize what you want your emails to look like, it's not very flexible. There are basic blocks you can use, but it is all fairly limited, so if you have a specific design you want for the look and feel of your email, you will have to make adjustments per what Eloqua is able to offer design-wise.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
We are moving to Peridot soon, but Eloqua has served me well. It's easy to use, fully functional, and a huge step up from regular emails.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
I work in Internal Communications, so it is nice to send our employees emails that look just as good as what our customers are receiving. These emails are mobile friendly and can use graphics and links, so they look a lot more professional than something coming directly from Outlook.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Contact fields vs. Custom Data Objects.... just expand the limits on contact fields!

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Be prepared to invest a lot of upfront time deploying the product. Don't take it for granted that things are set up correctly and double check everything. Don't breeze through set up, as missing/botching critical steps (e.g., email sender validation) can get you in hot water.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using Eloqua's marketing automation to trigger personalized emails based on user behavior has saved us an enormous amount of time. It's like having an extra full-time staff member.
