all_reviews.review_title: Really good in theory... not so much in practice.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
In theory, everything you can do in Eloqua is incredibly cool. The thing that I was most exigentes was the canvases that you could make to send email campaigns, because you could see the flow of information and build an entire email campaign with conditions and everything.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The very thing that got me so excited was the one that frustrated me the most. It was so apparently "simple" to set, but in actual practice, the canvas, we never managed to make it work as it was supposed to. We even had in our team expert programmers and IT people... we had coaching and an account executive from Oracle and we struggled a LOT with the tool.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email campaigns and the integration of them to a CRM system to asses the effectiveness of the campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: The thought for the marketing cloud
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Integrations - Oracle Marketing Cloud has a large range of great integrations with over 100 third party platforms.
Well-designed visual campaign builder - Similar to Infusionsoft, Oracle Marketing Cloud uses a nice visual campaign builder that's both intuitive and powerful to use.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Slow implementation time - Due to the types of organizations that typically use Oracle Marketing Cloud, implementation usually takes a long time.
No integration with Google Adwords - Oddly, there is no way to track PPC ROI using Oracle Marketing Cloud. This is particularly odd considering that many enterprise businesses will be spending hundreds of thousands to millions on PPC per year.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of their favourite features in Oracle Marketing Cloud is HyperSite, which allows users to quickly build personalized microsites using dynamic user content.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is by far one of the best marketing automation platforms
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
-Easy to use interface that does not require technical skills for basic campaign execution tasks like setting up emails, forms, landing pages, segments, and campaigns

-Highly customizable. This comes in handy with lead management workflows, advanced nurture campaigns, and integrations of all kinds but especially with CRMs (Salesforce.com, MS Dynamics Cloud, and Oracle Sales Cloud)

-Eloqua has features that allow you to segregate data, reporting, assets, etc. so all the users can share one Eloqua nicely. These are great features for larger marketing teams and/or teams with users in different regions with different needs.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
-Reporting functionality - Both my team and our customers have experienced challenges in reporting due to lack of seemingly basic features and export limitations within the Insight Reporting Engine.

-System downtime - Our customers have communicated frustrations over the past six months due to more frequent system-level downtimes when key data isn't being captured for processing which can have a relatively small to rather significant impact on the business.

-Less focus on development - While bigger, more popular features continue to be the focus of development, ie responsive landing page editor, native integrations with multiple third-party vendors, and the like; the other side of the development scale seems to have suffered from lack of focus, ie, new reporting on dynamic content but lacking click-through data.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Eloqua is well suited for clients with the need to automate marketing tasks to save on time and money. This would be most marketing teams and primarily B2B. Eloqua may be used for B2C marketing but there are better fit products for that.

Eloqua is especially great for large and/or complex marketing, sales, and IT teams. It has the ability to be customized to meet their needs while not being extremely difficult to setup and manage. It has functionality that its competitors lack to support global, large marketing teams.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows our small team to execute dozens of campaigns per year by leveraging some of the automation power in the platform.

It allows us to measure our marketing efforts' impact on sales revenue which are improving year over year.

The online help/resource library is not bad, but it's all learn and DIY unless you're willing to pay for support or unless you like spending time in a confusing forum community.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is clunky to say the least, and it requires a lot of practice and patience to work your way around - everything feels at least 5 or more clicks away.  The UI is not very clean. Their forms can be buggy at random times. Their design editor and templates are also less than intuitive and user friendly.

all_reviews.review_title: Robust marketing automation; invest in a seasoned admin.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
ORCL ELQ's framework is flexible enough that there are many ways to accomplish things. The solution is scalable; I've used it in several organizations and have yet found a way to stump it or outgrow its capabilities.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
ELQ is far from plug-and-play. It requires a lot of care and feeding and some orgs underestimate the amount of time required to keep things running smoothly. Some of its "old framework" architecture can be a bit clunky (i.e., Program Builder), but they are making great strides in modernizing with things like Program Canvas.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Do your homework when evaluating marketing automation platforms and be realistic in your expectations and capabilities. If all you're planning to do is automate batch-and-blast emails, ELQ is likely overkill. Invest in training or hire a seasoned admin, or you'll likely realize a fraction of its benefits.

Preparation is key - map you content, identify your power users, and don't gloss over integrations.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
The primary business problem we set out to solve with Eloqua was messaging prospects, leads, and customers at scale, and measuring the effectiveness of that outreach. We've since expanded into omnichannel marketing and ABM. To date, ELQ has met our needs along the way.

We now know who is engaging with what, and more importantly, what's NOT working, enabling our Program Managers to make data-driven decisions about their programs and measure the impact in metrics that resonate across the organization.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Multi-Channel Marketing On The Market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
This platform is so easy to use and unlike a lot of the platforms out there is designed beautifully. I really like the validation feature to make sure your campaigns are set up correctly before you launch. It allows you to run through each touchpoint and make sure they are all functioning correctly before you make it live.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The only thing I dislike is that it doesn't have a print or variable pdf function. I work in the print industry and creating personalized direct mail pieces and variable PDFs for personalized coupons in your emails is a must in my opinion. There aren't many platforms that have this feature.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
This platform allows me to have more dynamic marketing and it allows me to provide a unique marketing experience for my clients.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I like it that Oracle is *trying* to make updates to Eloqua, but the updates they do make do not bring it into this century.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The UI is antiquated and extremely frustrating to use. The user experience is absolutely the worst I've ever seen. Simple things like integrated single sign on, click to open contact records and the ability to directly download a report do not exist in Eloqua. The MOST frustrating thing is that the reports are not directly downloadable. Instead they are emailed to you. Then you have to sign into Eloqua, but the sign in boxes are not the same as they are when you ordinarily log in. Instead of 3 fields (one for company name, one for username, and one for password), the format is switched to 2 fields (one for company name/user name and then a second field for password). There are no clear directions on how to do this under the boxes. It is CRAZY and an awful, time consuming and frustrating experience.

Oh, and if you close the browser window without logging off (like you do with every other Saas product out there), you will not be able to log back in - you get stuck in some weird purgatory state and need to shut down your computer, clear your cache and use an incognito window to get back in. Eloqua has wasted more of my time than I care to think about. It is awful.

The email templates are C- - you need an HTML person to put together any good looking emails and there are no interactive (aka modern) landing page templates. We had to use a third-party landing page company to build out quizzes, calculators, etc.

Bottom line: there are MUCH better options for automated marketing out there. I have used others in my career and they all run circles around Eloqua.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
DO NOT USE ELOQUA if you have other options. The UI is antiquated and extremely frustrating to use. If you want to do anything "modern", like append data, create descent landing pages, etc., you will have to buy additional services from other vendors. The user experience is absolutely the worst I've ever seen. Simple things like integrated single sign on, click to open contact records and the ability to directly download a report do not exist in Eloqua. The MOST frustrating thing is that the reports are not directly downloadable. Instead they are emailed to you. Then you have to sign into Eloqua, but the sign in boxes are not the same as they are when you ordinarily log in. Instead of 3 fields (one for company name, one for username, and one for password), the format is switched to 2 fields (one for company name/user name and then a second field for password). There are no clear directions on how to do this under the boxes. It is CRAZY and an awful, time consuming and frustrating experience.

Oh, and if you close the browser window without logging off (like you do with every other Saas product out there), you will not be able to log back in - you get stuck in some weird purgatory state and need to shut down your computer, clear your cache and use an incognito window to get back in. Eloqua has wasted more of my time than I care to think about. It is awful.

The email templates are C- - you need an HTML person to put together any good looking emails and there are no interactive (aka modern) landing page templates. We had to use a third-party landing page company to build out quizzes, calculators, etc.

Bottom line: there are MUCH better options for automated marketing out there. I have used others in my career and they all run circles around Eloqua.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation. It has created more problems then it has solved with its wonky reporting features and unstable UI. The LInkedIN widget for Chrome is extremely unstable and almost unusable. Engage is also a huge fail.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
review_question_answers.answer:
DO NOT USE ELOQUA if you have other options. The UI is antiquated and extremely frustrating to use. If you want to do anything "modern", like append data, create descent landing pages, etc., you will have to buy additional services from other vendors. The user experience is absolutely the worst I've ever seen. Simple things like integrated single sign on, click to open contact records and the ability to directly download a report do not exist in Eloqua. The MOST frustrating thing is that the reports are not directly downloadable. Instead they are emailed to you. Then you have to sign into Eloqua, but the sign in boxes are not the same as they are when you ordinarily log in. Instead of 3 fields (one for company name, one for username, and one for password), the format is switched to 2 fields (one for company name/user name and then a second field for password). There are no clear directions on how to do this under the boxes. It is CRAZY and an awful, time consuming and frustrating experience.

Oh, and if you close the browser window without logging off (like you do with every other Saas product out there), you will not be able to log back in - you get stuck in some weird purgatory state and need to shut down your computer, clear your cache and use an incognito window to get back in. Eloqua has wasted more of my time than I care to think about. It is awful.

The email templates are C- - you need an HTML person to put together any good looking emails and there are no interactive (aka modern) landing page templates. We had to use a third-party landing page company to build out quizzes, calculators, etc.

Bottom line: there are MUCH better options for automated marketing out there. I have used others in my career and they all run circles around Eloqua.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Marketing automation. It has created more problems then it has solved with its wonky reporting features and unstable UI. The LInkedIN widget for Chrome is extremely unstable and almost unusable. Engage is also a huge fail.

I think there is not anything that Eloqua can't do. In a nutshell, Eloqua is a marketing automation system and can do what you would expect the marketing automation system to do. But if you want a bit more automation outside of 'just' the marketing then Eloqua shines with the capabilities it has.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The learning curve with Eloqua is a bit higher. The system is updating its interface for the better all the time but still, some things are not so shiny.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automating the inbound marketing as well the current customer flows. We can now ensure that we do not forget a contact anywhere. Also with GDPR now kicking in the Eloqua system makes sure we are on the track on this also.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
We use Eloqua to market to our prospects and current customers either independently or in conjunction with some of our partners as part of larger campaigns. Typically we are inviting them to a WebEx or live event or sharing case studies and blog posts about industry trends. Typically we are using our own list or a segment provided to us by a partner for the specific campaign criteria. Segmentation and campaign creation are solid. Eloqua is a true enterprise level tool. It gives you what you need to get the job done, it is easy to use and you have a lot of support through communities, tutorials, documentation and events

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I think there are some weaknesses around changes to the UI but look and feel aside I think the automation capabilities are the best out there today. You won't find it in the competition.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We didn't have any marketing before so it has had a tremendous impact. Allowing our marketing team to gain valuable insight to share across all levels of our organization. We have started using some of the data to determine when to re-engage with previous clients.

Return on Investment:
Ability to track end to end interactions
Increased analytics
Leveraging Marketing automatio

all_reviews.review_title: Incredibly Poor Product and Customer Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Integrates well with most CRM platforms. Has robust capabilities when it comes to marketing automation and functionality.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Product is buggy, has incredibly poor account management and customer support. Unable to send emails due to bad IP addresses that Oracle provides that will impact your deliver ability.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would strongly consider utilizing Marketo, Hubspot or other marketing automation platforms instead of Oracle's Eloqua. Since the acquisition they have become unreasonable and it shows in the platform. When you're unable to even send out basic emails and they don't want to propose solutions it goes to show how fall they have fallen from once being a top tier marketing automation platform.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were attempting to leverage the platform to market to our diverse customer base as well as for our sales force which numbers in the hundreds to leverage Eloqua Engage and Profiler. The platform is buggy and when you reach out for solutions that impact all of your emails or all of your users you get answers that may take months. Oracle is out of touch with their customers and it shows in the platform. We're moving off the platform even with a year left in our contract.

all_reviews.review_title: Easier to use than Salesforce Marketing Cloud
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua has worked very hard to make an application that is easy to visually program. Eloqua forms have extremely powerful post submit processing capacity that is easy to implement.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua has an old and outdated reporting engine. Getting the basics is fairly easy, but cumbersome. Most of the content used in Eloqua is built outside HTML applications so its lack of a modern email and landing page editor is not a huge issue, but will need to be resolved soon.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
By far the easiest of the enterprise level tools to use. Make sure and compare how easy setting up forms and form processing is within any application you are putting up against Eloqua. Look at the how simple using standard items like shared components, dynamic components, and landing pages are to use in Eloqua. Tools like Salesforce Marketing Cloud require way too much programming to do simple tasks. Make sure and define how you will be getting names into Eloqua and how simple Yes/No steps in campaigns are done in Eloqua.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
B2B marketing from email marketing, in person and webinar event marketing, to full attribution and influence tracking.

all_reviews.review_title: Decent Enterprise Product without Some of the Features of Marketo
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Ability to handle and process large amounts of data and build complex programs that would potentially crash of MA platforms. It's great to have a lot of flexibility with blank canvases to develop essentially anything you can think of. In Marketo, it could take several minutes (or longer) to refresh a smart list. In Eloqua, it usually only takes a few seconds.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The lack of simple features that you take for granted from Marketo that really make it more efficient to build programs. Cloning programs, ad bridge, web personalization, and attribution are all areas that I miss from Marketo. There is a lot that you can do with Eloqua, but the more robust features that Marketo offers (for an extra fee) are missed.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I'd evaluate Marketo as well. Just keep in mind that Marketo's product doesn't seem to be getting the type of investment it needs. I'd ask to see the product roadmap from both vendors.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are building complex flows in our buyers journey to move people down the funnel. Like most platforms, you get out what you put in. Eloqua is relatively easy to use and can handle many of the challenges that we are facing. Scaling is not an issue either. Another benefit is that, because Eloqua was clearly built for enterprise, you can set up data standardization that you wouldn't be able to do with Marketo.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is a powerful marketing automation platform. I've used it at a couple of workplaces now including at an agency that supported fortune 500 companies manage their instances of Eloqua. What I like best about Eloqua over other automation tools I've used is its flow chart view of campaigns. It's nice to be able to see each automation step visually mapped out in front of you from end to end.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I really dislike the reporting capabilities in Eloqua. Running reports is a surprisingly complex process and is not intuitive. At one time in my career, my full-time job was just for creating and running reports out of Eloqua. That's how involved the process is.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would suggest only consider using Eloqua for large organizations who run complex marketing campaigns. It's too large and complex of a tool for small marketing teams. You'll need campaign managers, an administrator, and even plan on having room in the budget for a person to run reports if you want to get the full breadth of use from the platform. You'll also likely want to hire an agency to help you with the initial setup.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
When I used Eloqua, it was at large international organizations because it is one of the best available tools for handling international automation campaigns really well. We were able to use the platform for running complex campaigns and in multiple languages.

I liked the user interface and navigations. Oracle does a wonderful job of reporting and their accuracy. One of my favorite features is the Lead Scoring.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
It's a big piece of software and can take some time to adjust and navigate through if you're not used to high-powered CRM systems.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
It's a large system to understand and get used to using. I'd recommend paying the extra cost to have Oracle help you set up the entire system specific to your company's unique needs and either hire Oracle or a 3rd party company to come in and train your employees. It's a lot to take in and understand and I think in order to get the full Oracle Eloqua experience and accurate reporting, all employees need to know how to use the system accurately and consistent with company standards.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
I used Oracle Eloqua and Siebel in the past with my home builder clients. They rely on extensive reporting as they're managing thousands of neighborhoods across the US. This system allowed them to streamline each process and report accurately on how their neighborhoods are doing in relation to sales and marketing. This data helped me look at the company's ROI and see if a shift needed to be made.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful, but expensive and time consuming to learn
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
If you have developers to work with, Eloqua can connect to a variety of marketing tech platforms and you can accomplish a wide variety of marketing and customer experience projects.

The ability to create custom and personalized landing pages has helped us boost conversion rates for many of our campaigns.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
To really make the most of this platform, you need access to a person or team who knows how to develop for it. Additionally, Eloqua is sold as a "do it all" platform, but it actually requires connectors and custom development to get to that point. Some of the connectors are expensive, as well.

Additionally, Eloqua's "responsive" email tempaltes do not work across all devices. It's been our experience that custom coded HTML emails fully tested outside of Eloqua (using Litmus or Email on Acid) work best.

There is also a steep learning curve. I've been using Eloqua for over 3 years now and only in the last year did I start feeling confident with it.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Be aware that you will need additional connectors and development resources if you want to use Eloqua as a true conductor for digital marketing. It does not "do it all" out of the box.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've put a robust onboarding program in place with Eloqua, which provides customized messaging based on data points for individual clients. We've been able to better target our promotional emails, stand up newsletter campaigns, behavior-based campaigns, and are taking advantage of landing pages for our paid advertising campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua works well for a midsize company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
We like that we are able to put projects into action quickly with the templates available in Eloqua.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
We dislike that there are very few customization options in the template, and we are limited with the visual aspect of how the emails can be seen by the intended audience.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Eloqua is a great system to use in order to reach out to a large group of people to communicate events, webcasts, webinars or other important business needs. We use Eloqua for digital even invitations, primarily to control registration and keep track of those that are attending and interacting with our brand. We have a dedicated team that works on sending out tests of digital emails, and these can be customized in different templates, and help maintain the integrity of our brand. We are able to use our brand colors, font, and ensure that our brand voice is heard through the email that our intended audience is receiving. The click-ability and overall appearance is professional and visually appealing, and is much more effective than a generic email from an automated system. I have been mostly happy with my user experience with sending out Eloqua emails to our clients, prospects and COIs.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
For a larger business, it is imperative that communications come across in a professional manner, rather than through a generic email, and Eloqua allows companies to connect quickly with a large group of people in a short amount of time.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua, in a class of its own.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua has been incremental in ensuring our organizational success in the B2B space. It is a vital aspect of our marketing program and we would not be able to effectively execute our complex marketing campaigns without it.  I love the ability to quickly implement our strategies and ensure there are a multitude of fail safes to sure our campaign will go smoothly. Utilizing features like dynamic content and the campaign canvas quickly allow you to see why Eloqua is the best platform on the market.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua could improve on it's WYSIWYG email and landing page builder but from what I understand this is on the road map. It also has an outdated UI on the reporting tool but this is slowing being updated with a new version. The app cloud partners are somewhat limited but if you feel comfortable with utilizing the API or only have limited need for partner apps this would be a limited concern.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Compare it to the competitors and you will quickly see how much better it is.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua has allowed us to scale at lightning speed and ensure that the only limitation to our marketing plan is our imagination. We have been able to easily execute and grow within the platform as our organization grows and Eloqua has done great to accelerate that growth. Eloqua has allowed us to easily transform our marketing program as new trends change within the industry and can ensure that the automation platform is not the limiting factor to any success we are working to achieve.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Marketing Automation System - Not for beginners
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I love the flexibility and customization

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Some navigation/features aren't intuitive

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would recommend making sure someone on your team has marketing automation experience, even if it's not Eloqua-specifically, because Oracle (and many of their partners/consultants) don't provide the best resources for complete marketing automation beginners. Things like best practices and high-level overviews of the capabilities of the tool aren't their strong suit - but they're great with the more technical and seasoned-automation professional questions.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua really helps automate many web and email practices, while also giving powerful personalization and segmentation opportunities. We were able to increase email engagement by about 20% in one year after implementing Eloqua and significantly reduced team member time for creating and deploying email campaigns.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
review_question_answers.answer: I would recommend making sure someone on your team has marketing automation experience, even if it's not Eloqua-specifically, because Oracle (and many of their partners/consultants) don't provide the best resources for complete marketing automation beginners. Things like best practices and high-level overviews of the capabilities of the tool aren't their strong suit - but they're great with the more technical and seasoned-automation professional questions.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Eloqua really helps automate many web and email practices, while also giving powerful personalization and segmentation opportunities. We were able to increase email engagement by about 20% in one year after implementing Eloqua and significantly reduced team member time for creating and deploying email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to learn, difficult to master
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
What I like most about Oracle Eloqua is the ease a Campaign can be configured on the Campaign canvas. The UI is user friendly and lets you quickly setup a comprehensive campaign in only a few minutes. The way the components interact is seamless, forms, segments everything comes together and connects on the Canvas.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Insights in Integrations, logging could be better. Including batch ID's in the logging would be very beneficial. Also looking forward to A/B Testing functionality, community and clients have been waiting for this for a long time. Luckily this is now on the Roadmap. The insights on platform use could also be improved.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Great tool for your Marketing Automation. When considering Eloqua please review how many (potential)customers you will be targeting, what size is your current database of contacts?

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead Nurturing and Lead Generation. With the -right campaigns with the right content at the right time -you're able to nurture and generate leads through Oracle Eloqua.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Marketing Automation solution for Medium sized and enterprise businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The integration options makes it easy to connect Eloqua with other products within the marketing landscape. The fact that you have standard integrations with several major CRM systems but at the same time are able to build your own integration is very nice. Next to this, you can build your own connections using the AppCloud Developer framework which gives you the possibility to build feeder, decision action and some other services.

Next to the integration, I like the campaign canvas more and more, it gives a very clear overview of your campaign and with the easy drag and drop solution you can expand your campaign within seconds.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle needs some time to get back up to speed after they purchased Eloqua. The roadmap has some promising things on it, but it still takes a while before they arrive. Some of the features that are planend for the future are already standard within the competitor solution

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
make sure that the product fits your needs before you take the decision. Eloqua itself has a lot of features that might be overwhelming. Also, make sure you actually need the specific features of Eloqua. In case you have a short sales cycle, it might be more interesting to look at Oracle Responsys instead of Eloqua. Are you a multinational and looking for a solid Marketing Automation solution, no need to look further!

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated campaigns that can run over extended periods, and personalisation of outgoing messages (both emails and text messages) making the customer feel more valued

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle Eloqua is a fascinating product given the depth and breadth of marketing automation capabilities. Recent UI enhancements have made the system visually more appealing. The Campaign Canvas makes the set up and execution of campaigns easy, and the integration with Salesforce and cloud apps available (GoToWebinar) speed campaign tracking.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
We're a SME business and the tool is just too big for our organization. We have four administrators worldwide and Eloqua is only part of our roles. If Eloqua were our sole responsibility I'm sure we would use the more to our advantage.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Enables our organization to engage with customers and prospects via email marketing, allows the creation of landing pages and forms, and is the single location where all of our marketing prospect data is stored.

all_reviews.review_title: It's a killer database, exactly what we needed to get us started with marketing automation.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua was our first "major" fully integrated marketing automation system and it really helped us launch a more cohesive and planned content marketing program. We're a B2B company with a Complex structure of clients and prospects--and our CRM didn't offer communication. Eloqua helped us organize and enable a marketing plan that dramatically increased our MQL recognition and truly drive leads to sales.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
FYI, Q2 2017 was our last use of Eloqua, this doesn't account for new features rolled out.

1. Not a great design editor. And, small in-house teams don't have html folks really. We just need to produce at high volume.

2. It's not (wasn't) a cohesive digital tool. So other tools brought it website reporting and digital campaign tools that make reporting efforts more comprehensive.

3. When we signed on in early 2015, Training was limited to Eloqua University and CRAZY expensive per license. It also featured an outdated unfriendly user interface and restrictive viewing formats. We would not pay for that again. Eloqua's open website community/FAQ is great. Use that! License money was wasted.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
One of my favorite things about Eloqua is the account management structure. My team had a bi-weekly call with a really smart Eloqua team member, dedicated to us, which was used as a chance to walk through our real life work and projects. Our account reps were the equivalent of ongoing trainers, client services, and advocates within Oracle. Invaluable.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Helped us Organize and launch a serious B2B marketing program by helping us understand and reach our prospects (a group that also includes clients).

all_reviews.review_title: High powered Marketing Automation but sometimes hard to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The campaign and reporting functions are very powerfiul and easy to use.  Reports can be exported to Excel files and can be easily converted into Pivot Tables for further drill down.  Campaigns are visual and easy to build and execute.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
creating html emails is difficult using the internal editor.  To make it (much) easier I create and copy and paste with Adobe DreamWeaver and Eloqua.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Powerful program and accomplishes what I want, just remember that the creation of html emails is not easy and may require an outside editor.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Effective and efficient email marketing and communications with our customers and prospects.  We accomplish this with one off emails as well as specific campaigns and general drip campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Robust System With Alot of Functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I like the options Eloqua provides. It's a system that has many features that people may never even get around to using, but it has what you need to conduct effective lead generation/nurturing and it's all in one system.

Campaign Canvas! This the best method for building campaigns and it's a nice, empty canvas and you build what you need. If you need to build email campaigns or nurture campaigns, this is the selling point.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
- It can be buggy. I used Eloqua at my last job and the system was incredibly buggy.
- No Autosave! I don't know how a system like this doesn't have autosave (maybe it's changed by now) but I lost so much work because of no autosave and the system kicks you out very fast.
- Not much dedicated support, I relied on the Eloqua community to answer questions and figure out problems.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
This system is best for large companies. If you're just starting out with marketing automation, you're probably best going with something else initially and upgrading to Eloqua later because it's a robust system.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Some CRM, but primarily used for marketing automation, lead scoring and conversions on landing pages.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Segmenting is probably the best feature they have.  The UX is very intuitive and helps you think through the basic structure of your campaign.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The design feature is limiting.  Sometimes I find myself losing assets on the page if I drag them out of the email by accident, then they will show up in the actual email.  I always test my emails, so this has never been a huge problem, but it is rather annoying.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Invest in your employees' training!  I can't stress that enough.  I had to learn through one-on-one sessions, booklets, a colleague's notes, videos, etc.  It was a very long learning curve that could have been avoided through their formal training program.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using this for general solicitation and event reach-out.  Since we can A/B test subject lines, layouts, etc., it's helped us learn how to better serve our audience.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful and flexible, yet has some quirks
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Ease of creating landing pages and emails. Generally content management is easy. Complex campaign logic is a plus. Possibility to connect it with anything you imagine- CRM, SAP, etc. Reporting is easy (though complex analytics requires special user account, which costs extra). It can handle large databases with ease (tried with +4M contacts).

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle often introduces technical changes which results in increased downtime and sometimes critical errors. Has "bad" days when everything works super slow. Sometimes it is too easy to hurt the database - blank contact fields unintentionally. Extra features for complex analytics and database maintenance cost extra, significantly extra.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Very powerful, but be sure to take caution and implement it correctly. Don't spare on consultants, it will payoff later.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation - emails campaigns, landing pages, telemarketing. Our team is resposible for lead generation in a B2B environment.

all_reviews.review_title: ELoqua Still great for marketing, less great for support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua has made a lot of improvements and continues to do so. The Program Canvas was a great addition and they have continued to grow in their use of third party apps since Oracle's takeover. The ability to track opens and clicks is fantastic with this tool.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The Oracle support services are its biggest drawbacks. Filing a support ticket is almost worthless. The people who work in support are terrible at best and incompetent at worse. They do not generally help you at all, but either direct you to pre-written help documents whoch often do not even address the issue your are having or make you restate your question four or five different times. Most times, you are forced to either solve the problem yourself.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua helps us solve for our automated marketing campaigns. We have realized a great benefit with its tracking ability for clicks and opens as we can gauge our audience interaction with our messaging.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer: Eloqua has made a lot of improvements and continues to do so. The Program Canvas was a great addition and they have continued to grow in their use of third party apps since Oracle's takeover. The ability to track opens and clicks is fantastic with this tool.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer: The Oracle support services are its biggest drawbacks. Filing a support ticket is almost worthless. The people who work in support are terrible at best and incompetent at worse. They do not generally help you at all, but either direct you to pre-written help documents whoch often do not even address the issue your are having or make you restate your question four or five different times. Most times, you are forced to either solve the problem yourself.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Eloqua helps us solve for our automated marketing campaigns. We have realized a great benefit with its tracking ability for clicks and opens as we can gauge our audience interaction with our messaging.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool with a modern UX interface focused on efficiency
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Really like Eloqua's approach to Drip Campaign management, Forms / Landing pages and the ability to import and export data easily.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Reporting interface works well, but the visuals are rather clunky (excel style columns n rows). This might be what some people want, but ideally i'd like this to match (visually) the style of the whole application. Also, some limitations with Custom Object reporting unless you pay extra for additional licensing (Analyzer License).

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Good move against competitors like Marketo, Hubspot or Pardot

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping our Newsletter and email marketing robust and using as minimal resources as possible via automation. Automation is possible with this tool quite easily and not so easy with others.

all_reviews.review_title: Easiest Product for Managing our Demand Generation Programs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
We use Eloqua for all of our demand generation activities. Here's a few areas that it works best for us...
- Synchronization with SalesForce to upload and update contacts
- Synchronization with WebEx
- Ease of use for even the not so savvy HTML marketers
- Reporting features

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There are a few areas related to the UI that I would like to see changed - mostly on the campaign canvas. For example, when you set an evaluate period to 6 days - it would be helpful to see what 6 days is from the point of campaign activation.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Take the training courses - they're really helpful!

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Eloqua, we are able to create and schedule in multiple emails and campaigns. We can "set and forget" emails, which is extremely helpful. Once we build the HTML, we just schedule everything in and it's helpful not to have to go back and constantly make updates.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool, often buggy, still would recomend
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Lots of features and functionality, customizable, lots of automation options. I like that you can still use the HTML editor if you prefer that to the WYSIWYG editor. Integrates with a lot of other software programs. Integrations are fairly easy to manage. The campaign flow builder is very visual and easy to understand even for people not familiar with the software.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua can be very buggy, especially since the purchase by Oracle. Their support is also poor in my mind.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would say Eloqua is the biggest and most powerful option out there, but they are still figuring out how to be a part of the Oracle family so there are some hiccups, but nothing that has serious impact.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Eloqua for email marketing, landing pages, gating, event registrations, welcome and lead nurturing programs, lead scoring and so much more.

all_reviews.review_title: Good tool depending on your preferences
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I like the customizability that comes with Eloqua. There is a lot more flexibility with setting up campaigns/segments/etc. than with other automation tools. I like the set up of the Campaigns, where you can see the branches and arrange the steps visually in a way that makes sense to you. Eloqua is more technical than other tools, with more of an "engineer" feel rather than a "marketing" feel.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
With all the customizability comes confusion and difficulty to grasp simple tasks sometimes. If you are not in Eloqua 24/7 then it is difficult to figure out how to complete simple tasks - like pulling a report. Also, there are many moving parts to creating an email campaign in Eloqua and you have to navigate to each section within Eloqua in order to create each separate part, instead of being able to do it all in one place. Besides the features, Eloqua is very very slow about 50% of the time, and work fails to be saved and gets written over often - leading to frustration and more work on my end. Visually, Eloqua is not as appealing as other automation tools. It's more text-based than icons and images. Not a deal breaker but just an observation.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
If you are a more technical thinker, rather than visual, then Eloqua may be the tool for you.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Solving the problem of coordinating and automating email sends for hundreds of event campaigns and webinar campaigns, from the invitations to the reminder emails to the follow up emails. It allows me one place to view all my campaigns and organize my database.

all_reviews.review_title: Get the most out of your email campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
We love how simple it is to build email campaigns using Eloqua and to send them out to our target segments. the analytics we get back from Eloqua are also extremely useful and help us determine if our campaigns are effective enough or if we need to make changes. We also really like the dashboard and the fact that you have a recent updates section, and a section with the last things you were working on. This makes it very simple to make changes quickly or pick up where you left off. The stats right in the dashboard are also a great way to get a quick overview of how your campaigns and social accounts are performing.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
A bit of training is required in the beginning to get the hang of using the program. The user interface could also be updated, but this is not a big issue for us.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
This is a very powerful program that will really change the way you approach your marketing. The social features integrated in this software really make using this software worth it. We noticed an immediate difference in how effective we were able to make our marketing efforts after we began using Eloqua.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are now able to effectively track our marketing efforts and to easily plan our marketing campaigns and track how our customers perceive our efforts. The social listening and analytic tools help us clearly evaluate our efforts.

This makes it very simple to make changes quickly or pick up where you left off. List uploads are a breeze, along with email templates (creating editable or HTML version). The dynamic content is great. I really like the Filters that can be built and run against other data sets. Segmentation is also key for campaign sends.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Some of the integration & Program Builder area can be very confusing including the UI and the multiple browser windows that open when you are within the tool.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have both B2B and B2C efforts. On the B2C side it is automating our customer lifecycle from first purchase to renewal and after (lapsed). We also automate trials to our software and execute other batch/one-time promotional sends.

On the B2B side we have a customer lifecyclet track and various prospect email campaigns. Some are automated while others are batch/blast but use segments. We have seen great success on the B2C side although revenue reporting is not within Eloqua itself but can be referenced outside of the tool.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
We've been able to use and work with the software to accomplish most of our email marketing and database goals. It's a very powerful software that can be used for many use cases-- we send our webinar, event, and nurture emails with Eloqua and use it for segmenting our database (it integrates with our CRM). Their support team has always been available and helpful.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
If you're new to the software, it can take some time to become a comfortable and confident user. It seems to be outdated in some respects-- some newer functionality that you would like to use if you're keeping up with the latest marketing best practices, and that other cloud software companies seem to offer, aren't available.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would recommend prioritizing what you are looking for in a marketing automation platform and consider your options with that prioritized list in mind, to get the solution that best fits your needs.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is an industry standard for large organizations looking to use marketing automation. I love the flexibility and that it is extremely robust. The email editor is easy to use (although could include responsive design for folks who do not know HTML/CSS responsive email design). Segment building is VERY robust and flexible.

The product is ideal for large scale organizations with many business units and marketing managers needing to use the program because there are customized security settings that allow for each user to have unique settings.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There is a steep learning curve and some of the more advanced features are difficult to understand and take a long time to implement. (i.e. Custom Data Objects, Program Builder, APIs & Integrations, etc) Although they have been making incredible improvements to their UI in the past year.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I recommend getting deep into the Topliners community and really getting to know some of the power users. The community typically answers your exact questions. Oracle also provides GREAT step by step user guides  in their Help Center here - http://docs.oracle.com/cloud/latest/marketingcs_gs/OMCAA/

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have solved email marketing, marketing automation and we are working towards integration with our CRM to improve lead nurturing, lead scoring, content mapping and buyer journeys.

It was at the request of management that we learned it, just in case we were required to use on a regular basis. I had to use it for no more than a few weeks.

Have have nothing bad to say about the product. I really mean I can't say there is anything I didn't like about it. I didn't really use it too much only when required by management. Well maybe the only thing I didn't like was how hard it started off using the software. Other than that I can't say anything bad about Oracle software.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
That if anyone wants an inexpensive and reliable software take make things smooth and easy for them, then Oracle Eloqua  will be the best investment that one can ever make. It's a great addition in my opinion that every place of employment should have.

I think Oracle has the best practice templates / programs & tools. The program also mobile friendly and is also good for real time dashboard and reporting. Other features such as unified marketing calendar, proves to be a great benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: Working with Mass Emails, Contact Activity & Fresher Sales
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I enjoy the ability to set triggers to see customer activity- it is nice to be able to set tripwires to see if a customer has interest in a particular link or email campaign. In addition, the analytics have helped me determine when a particular set of users is more likely to look at an email.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I haven't seen consistency out of some of the ratings given to leads within our system. I believe certain rules might be set by my marketing department- I am seeing times when a user is more active in opening emails or doing certain high-value activity like registering for an account but it does not register as a high value lead.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Consider if your marketing team has the ability to monitor and set rules to work with the sales team. In our organization there is no time for training and Eloqua tends to be less intuitive tool than Salesforce, Workday and other tools that we use on a daily basis. I can tell Eloqua has great power but it is challenging.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Contacting customers at the right time with the right message. This tool helps you be more relevant and connects you with the right people.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
the robust nature of the email tool, and the various marketing options. I was impressed with the ability to segment lists, and target multiple groups with different emails, and schedule multiple ways to follow up the email blasts. I love the seamless integration with Salesforce.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Sometime the interface is a bit clunky and difficult to understand. I also found that adding and creating lists from some data sources required too many steps. When creating emails, we have run into some glitches that cause our emails to not appear exactly as we would like on some email platforms.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
It is quite expensive, but we realized that the benefits are quite worth it. The ability to consolidate so many advanced features is great.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We jumped to Eloqua from mailchimp. Eloqua allows us to manage our email campaigns across segments, and allows us to integrate with Salesforce to maximize our e-marketing efforts. all_reviews.review_title: Overly complicated, Poor Integration with Salesforce
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Campaign design and automation is very flexible and feature rich. Tracking capabilities are excellent. WYSIWYG form and email editors are easy to use.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Overly technical for simple marketing automation tasks. May be good as a standalone tool but the Integration with Salesforce is overly complex and has a lot of issues. Their community is full of complex work arounds other customers have developed to try to overcome the poor integration.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Unless you are looking to build very complicated, multi-touch, multi-year campaigns there are tools that accomplish the same thing in much simpler way. I've used Eloqua at 3 different companies and Marketing end users have really struggled with it at each company.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Able to build complex, multi-touch marketing campaigns that span months to years.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Our company works to leverage our database, without causing too much list fatigue. The tools available within Eloqua allow us to target our messages to right market segments, and ensures that we can suppress email addresses that have already received a marketing message from us on a given day.

Additionally, we have it synced with our event registration software, so that we add new contacts into the portal automatically.

The ability to schedule the deployments on the weekends has also allowed us capitalize on underutilized deployment times, resulting in higher open and click-through rates.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
After a full year of use, I have no issues with Eloqua.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Take advantage of the training provided by your vendor.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
By using Eloqua forms, we have been able to clean up our data. Additionally, using the forms, we have been better able to capture leads, resulting in additional sales opportunities.

all_reviews.review_title: Great automation platform and much more!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The user interface is fantastic.  The "campaign canvas" as they call it allows the user to drag and drop segments, assets, decision steps, and action steps with ease.  Creating emails, landing pages, and forms within an easy to navigate editor is a huge plus.  Eloqua also integrates seamlessly with Compendium, Oracle's Content Management platform.  Content can be vetted and approved from Compendium and promoted into Eloqua and used within emails, landing pages, and dynamic content modules.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The event and custom data modules still appear to be on the old Eloqua 9 UI.  That needs to be updated ASAP.  The program builder, while a great tool, is tough to navigate and can be rough when building a new program for the first few times.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Great tool for the money.  If used correctly you can do wonderful things for your direct marketing.  Oracle support does tend to be sluggish and you may not receive the answers right away but you can escalate issues rather easily to support management.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Here are a few bullets to answer this:
- automated all of our campaigns including events, webinars, promotions, product, nurture, and market driven campaigns.
- develop and execute form strategies in our campaigns to learn more about the customer.
- serving up the right content to the right customer at the right time

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
To start, I think Eloqua University is a great resource - to be able to take courses on such an extensive listing of subjects is remarkable (and the courses are offered at multiple times to offer the opportunity for people in different timezones to take them). Next, I like that for the most part, the ability to create campaigns, landing pages, forms, and segments are relatively easy. I like the amount of data they allow you to store within their database for contacts (nearly 300 fields). I like the ability to integrate with relative ease with Salesforce. I like that it is much more easier to navigate than my previous few marketing automation systems.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I think lead scoring still needs work. I think they need to increase the amount of documents they allow you to store in their progressive profiling component. I dislike that I don't know what level of support I am going to get from their tech support - if I get someone good, I know I am going to get the answer I need but if I get someone new, I know within the first 90 seconds that I am wasting my time. I dislike that they try to sell you on their professional services which was a waste of time and money for me. I think Insights could be a little more intuitive as it it just a basic reporting tool.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
It is definitely the best marketing automation tool that i have used out of the three.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
A marketing automation platform that would be easy to use and allow our team in multiple countries to function effectively.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Elqoua is an excellent tool for marketing automation. Eloqua also give us the ability to quickly segment our contact database allowing us to market to the correct contacts. Eloqua University is a great resource for users with no experience. It has many hand on classes that allows you to get familiar with their product very quickly. Eloqua uses a WYSIWYG interface that makes it very simple to build HTML emails, landing pages and forms. This is especially helpful for people with little to no HTML or CSS experience.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Program builder is are area of the tool that is very powerful but not user friendly. There are many different menu options and it can become overwhelming very quickly. We recently integration with CRM and it was a very difficult process that required a lot of IT support. The reporting piece of Eloqua can also be tricky for inexperienced users.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Elqoua does that basic task of marketing automation extremely well. It can be difficult to integrate the system with your CRM but with the right IT folks, it can be done. Eloqua has great training program as well as topliner which is a social platform that allows Eloqua users to share best practices and ask question.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We primarily use it for B2B marketing activities. The system allows us to create automated marketing campaigns with saves us from having to send each email manually as well as the ability to easily report on these campaigns. We have significantly reduced the time for a prospective lead to be passed to sales. Eloqua has great training program through Eloqua University as well as topliner which is a social platform that allows Eloqua users to share best practices and ask question. Many of the tasks that we use to preform manually have now been automated saving both time and money.

It helps identify people who aren't completely satisfied with what we're sending them, and correct it quickly, as well as identify leads while they are early in their buying journey

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is a powerful marketing automation tool that has the largest breadth of functionality and most extensive customization of any MAT solution I have used.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua tends to have a lot of bugs right after a release.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua solves the business problem of communicating with leads (lead generation, nurture, opt out management).  That statement is very minimalistic.  Its like saying oil is a liquid.  What Eloqua does is empower the marketing organization to communicate with leads when it makes the most sense on a topic that the lead is interested in.  For example, Eloqua can catch leads that have partway registered for an event and nurture them to fully register; it can be setup to determine when a lead is ready to speak to a sales person, it can manage the registration process for webinars and nurture leads to attend and then follow up after the webinar; it can be used to personalize all communications; in can be integrated with any number of other MarTech tools from CMS solutions to webinars.

Eloqua's strength is in its breadth of functionality embedded in the system, its integration with other marketing products, and its ability to be easily customized to meet the specific needs of the business.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is the Industry Standard for Marketing Automation for a Good Reason
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
If you are an enterprise company, Oracle Eloqua is the platform for you. The choices after that seem to take into account sacrificing certain aspects of marketing automation in exchange for a lower cost. If you want a scalable tool, this is the one for you. They have years on their closest competitor which means a lot more integration experience and native connections than possible with other tools. For an SMB, you have a lot of options in the space and using Eloqua might be like driving a Ferrari to pick up groceries; however, they have a pricing model and edition trim for SMB, as well. You don't have to drive the Ferarri, there is a grocery-getter, as well.

I have used the tool for 7 years mostly in conjunction with Salesforce.com and the integration between those two systems is cake-walk. The amount of time these two have been partners really shows in it's native connectivity strength.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is Software-as-a-Service and is constantly being patched and upgraded, so naturally there are some quirks and bugs. I understand this. If I wanted static software that was bulletproof, I would buy a CD. Hang tight and these issues will get resolved. 7 years of experience with Eloqua is telling you this.

One area that has fallen behind is the Eloqua Support, likely due to the acquisition and hoping this is just a growing pain, which is the impression that I am getting. There are a few more hoops to jump through and the new Oracle Support interface wasn't the easiest to transition into, but once you have tickets open--they get responded to just like before.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Everything is contingent on where you want to go with your automation strategy. Eloqua is the industry standard for a reason--they've been in the marketing automation space significantly longer than their closest competitor and do provide the best suite of tools to support it.

The team edition or "standard edition" can be enough for a company that is an enterprise company, but not quite there yet with their automation strategy. Meaning, you don't necessarily have to buy the Enterprise edition just because you are an enterprise-level company. There is an affordable trim for smaller companies, as well, but there are a lot of competitor options for these smaller businesses, as well.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Renewals and vendor shopping when contracts near expiration is always a hurdle. Price will always be a factor. Switching from one platform for another is almost never a lateral move, so make sure you choose the right one for your company from the start. If you intend to switch purely for monetary reasons, you may want to reconsider due to the large step backwards to do so. This will cost more than the savings would catch up to in years. If you have legitimate concerns about the platforms performance, I would do a lot of research to make sure the competitor doesn't have the same or worse. Also, another thing to consider is with a newer platform competitor means fewer experts to turn to, either as consultants or new hire employees. A lot of the times customers tend to think the grass is greener on the other side, but really the grass is greener where you water it.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer:
If you are an enterprise company, Oracle Eloqua is the platform for you. The choices after that seem to take into account sacrificing certain aspects of marketing automation in exchange for a lower cost. If you want a scalable tool, this is the one for you. They have years on their closest competitor which means a lot more integration experience and native connections than possible with other tools. For an SMB, you have a lot of options in the space and using Eloqua might be like driving a Ferrari to pick up groceries; however, they have a pricing model and edition trim for SMB, as well. You don't have to drive the Ferarri, there is a grocery-getter, as well.

I have used the tool for 7 years mostly in conjunction with Salesforce.com and the integration between those two systems is cake-walk. The amount of time these two have been partners really shows in it's native connectivity strength.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer:
Eloqua is Software-as-a-Service and is constantly being patched and upgraded, so naturally there are some quirks and bugs. I understand this. If I wanted static software that was bulletproof, I would buy a CD. Hang tight and these issues will get resolved. 7 years of experience with Eloqua is telling you this.

One area that has fallen behind is the Eloqua Support, likely due to the acquisition and hoping this is just a growing pain, which is the impression that I am getting. There are a few more hoops to jump through and the new Oracle Support interface wasn't the easiest to transition into, but once you have tickets open--they get responded to just like before.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
review_question_answers.answer:
Everything is contingent on where you want to go with your automation strategy. Eloqua is the industry standard for a reason--they've been in the marketing automation space significantly longer than their closest competitor and do provide the best suite of tools to support it.

The team edition or "standard edition" can be enough for a company that is an enterprise company, but not quite there yet with their automation strategy. Meaning, you don't necessarily have to buy the Enterprise edition just because you are an enterprise-level company. There is an affordable trim for smaller companies, as well, but there are a lot of competitor options for these smaller businesses, as well.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Renewals and vendor shopping when contracts near expiration is always a hurdle. Price will always be a factor. Switching from one platform for another is almost never a lateral move, so make sure you choose the right one for your company from the start. If you intend to switch purely for monetary reasons, you may want to reconsider due to the large step backwards to do so. This will cost more than the savings would catch up to in years. If you have legitimate concerns about the platforms performance, I would do a lot of research to make sure the competitor doesn't have the same or worse. Also, another thing to consider is with a newer platform competitor means fewer experts to turn to, either as consultants or new hire employees. A lot of the times customers tend to think the grass is greener on the other side, but really the grass is greener where you water it.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I enjoys how intuitive the campaign canvas is for user functionality.  With very little training I was able to build out initial welcome/nurture campaigns AND train in other users on my team how to build similar type campaigns...

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Our organization has been an Eloqua user for the past four years but put very little focus on the platform.  It wasn't until our CMO attended EE13 and decided the product should be the foundation of our marketing efforts.  If we could have had more product users engaged earlier and had a tighter relationship with our account executive I believe we would have used the platform earlier/more often...

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
The more members of your team who are trained as users the better your organization will understand modern marketing.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
1) we are strengthening our relationship with Sale.  By finding agreement on a marketing/sales inquiry funnel we're providing better qualified leads to our reps.
2) we are gaining better understanding of campaign ROI.  In the past we had no idea of closed loop reporting or what happened to inquiries after they were passed off to sales
3) management has more visibility into the metrics w/ Eloqua Insights

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful, but sometimes frustrating, marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
It helps us automate many of our marketing functions. We use it for nurture programs, routing leads to CRM, automated account notification emails, newsletter and promotional email sends. It's fairly easy to build out emails, landing pages, and forms and get them live within hours. Great community (Topliners) to go to for advice and problem solving.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
E10 has it's share of bugs and we seem to find every one. We have a large database and we send a large number of emails, so we are often told that our email sends/segments/contact filters/etc. are too large and need to be adjusted. Reports constantly time out for us or we have to log out and log back in to get them to work. Support is great sometimes and other times leaves a lot to be desired.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Set best practices for your company before you implement and make sure everyone is on board. It's easy for the system to quickly become a mess when you have several people using it and no clear direction.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to get leads to our sales team and have conversations with our customers via emails.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is the top of the line marketing automation platform!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua provides so much training, education, and support that we are able to execute all of our marketing automation campaigns without any problems.  The Eloqua Community (Topliners) is full of amazing information, knowledge, and people that are willing to offer help and support at all times of the day and night.

The Insight and Reporting is very detailed and easy to use as well.
If you and your company are looking for a marketing automation platform, Eloqua is definitely the top-of-the-line product.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There is not very much to dislike, but the one thing I can't wait for them to change is the fact that Eloqua is built for Firefox browser. My favorite browser to use has been Chrome and I have never been a big fan of using FIrefox.  I am getting use to it now.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
If you are going to use Eloqua, make sure you use every resource that they provide.  For the first year we had it, we only used it to send out emails and it wasn't worth the cost.  Once we started taking advantage of all of it's capabilities, we took full advantage of everything it offers.
Like my boss says, "We had a Lamborghini sitting in our garage and we only drove it to the mailbox and back."

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to run reports and provide insight to our executive team and company stakeholders that show how efficient our marketing programs and campaigns are and how we are improving on a quarterly basis.  This is raising the support and confidence that the marketing team recieves from them and is improving our company's bottom-line.
