reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Emarketing Specialist - Certified Eloqua Product Master

all_reviews.review_title: Marketing Automation for the Modern Marketer - Eloqua is the Total Package!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
What I like best - the very best - about Eloqua is that it allows marketers so much flexibility in terms of data and integration management. For example, I can build a bi-directional integration with our enterprise data warehouse leveraging a SFTP site - little to no IT support needed. I can create and update Custom Data Objects in Eloqua - similar to Custom Objects in SFDC - no vendor or partner support needed. I can connect third-party vendor platforms (based on the vendor-built connector) to Eloqua very easily - in one particular case - in less than five minutes. There's a lot to love about the front-end as well, but the back-end is my primary playground and I haven't heard of another marketing automation vendor that provides this type of flexibility.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Are there little things here and there I'd like to see managed differently? Sure, but IMO none of them rank a "dislike" as they're not roadblocks to my teams accomplishing our goals and objectives. Honestly, what I dislike most is that I simply don't have enough time in my day to do everything I'd like to do - that we can do - in/around Eloqua. I've been an Eloqua Power user for over six years and I still learn something new almost every time I log in to the platform.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Research, research, research your requirements - both current and future state - and then go to your peer social networks for more information as its true that "you get what you pay for." Build your primary use cases for "a day in the life of a marketer" at your company and share that with Eloqua and other vendors you're considering to build into their product demo for you and your team. Join Topliners - an online community (hosted by Eloqua) of marketing and sales professionals interested in marketing automation and driving top line revenue - and consider its value as an extension to your team (I could write an entire review of Topliners alone - it's my go-to in so many ways).

all_reviews.review_title: If you're serious about marketing to scale, there's only one solution -- Eloqua
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The system is extremely flexible. The out-of-the-box product can be customized to meet your business needs and goal whether you are a B2B focused firm or consumer focused. We have made several customintegrations with Eloqua to augment our marketing programs that has helped our business scale. Other systems on the market simply could not handle the volume of traffic and complexity -- Eloqua does all the heavy lifting for us.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
If you are new to Marketing Automation, it's important to do your homework. Eloqua is not a magic solution to your marketing conundrum. You have to work at it, you have to staff it, and you have to keep up with the latest innovations and trends. If you are a Marketing nerd, you're going to love being a part of the community and enhancing your marketing programs. If you are more of a "marketing miser" this probably isn't the solution you are looking for.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Remember that Eloqua is a tool. Your tool is only as good as the craftsman who wields it. If you are going to make the investment in a Marketing Automation system you need to make sure you have a team that is ready to execute.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Generating more targeted TOFU inquiries for our Enterprise Sales Division
- Increase % of transactional Online revenue
- Increase brand awareness
- Increase MOM % of MQLs
- Increase Sales Pipline

all_reviews.review_title: Next Level Automation & Strong Community to Boot
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The Eloqua user community is strong and supportive. For me this is just as important as the features and functionality. Each of our roles and businesses face unique challenges; learning best practices, connecting with users and Eloqua support and staff makes doing my job significantly easier and my campaigns more successful.

I also love how Eloqua works "out of the box", like any large company we have a few of our own work arounds and integrations but generally speaking Eloqua offers the functionality we need (and then some).  I also love how user friendly the new E10 version is. We launched on E9 and when I first received a deo of E10 I squealed (yes out loud). To be able to create emails and landing pages without digging into the HTML is an incredible time saver.

Finally, the partner community is awesome. I have leveraged several of the cloud connectors and have a list of others that I want to try. Working with these 3rd party developers has been a breeze. Their connectors work, their support staff knows how to implement quickly, and most are priced rather competitively.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Give me more filters. The filter capabilities are on par with other solutions so it's not like Eloqua is lacking. But at the top of my wish list is I'd love to have more filter criteria to work with.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Think big! Plan early! Planning is essential, when getting started there are lots of things that need to be thought through. Take the time to develop your processes and bet practices. That part is never fun but it is worth it. Also, think BIG, like REALLY BIG! What would be the most amazing campaign you could run? Then back into how you could do that through Eloqua and Eloqua products. Also, don't be afraid to hire a certified partner. When you are just starting out, if you take my advice and think big your teams won't be ready to implement complex campaigns. But there are partners who can execute for you. In this instance not only do you get a really snazzy campaign but you learn along the way how to replicate the approach for future campaigns.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Chief Operations Officer and Managing Consultant

all_reviews.review_title: The best solution for marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
* Sophisticated flexible architecture that allows us to build our specific business processes into the system
* Application is scalable and supports large databases and rapid growth
* Simple APIs that have a large partner eco-system, application is easy to build upon and extend
* Fantastic customer community (Topliners)

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
* Reporting engine (Insights) can be slow and cumbersome to use.  Some reports that seem simple in concept are difficult to create.  Also doesn't easily support multiple report administrators.
* Only payment method is charging for contact volume, having a payment method of charging for email volume would help with consumer databases.
* There are some bugs and nuances that can be frustrating at times

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I highly recommend Eloqua to any company considering marketing automation software.  I've been a customer for 7 years at 4 different companies.  It's sophisticated platform, large partner eco-system, and commitment to customers has made me a faithful customer and a major advocate.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer:
* Sophisticated flexible architecture that allows us to build our specific business processes into the system
* Application is scalable and supports large databases and rapid growth
* Simple APIs that have a large partner eco-system, application is easy to build upon and extend
* Fantastic customer community (Topliners)

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
review_question_answers.answer:
* Reporting engine (Insights) can be slow and cumbersome to use.  Some reports that seem simple in concept are difficult to create.  Also doesn't easily support multiple report administrators.
* Only payment method is charging for contact volume, having a payment method of charging for email volume would help with consumer databases.
* There are some bugs and nuances that can be frustrating at times

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
review_question_answers.answer: I highly recommend Eloqua to any company considering marketing automation software.  I've been a customer for 7 years at 4 different companies.  It's sophisticated platform, large partner eco-system, and commitment to customers has made me a faithful customer and a major advocate.

What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?

- Flexible and scalable application
- You can make it as complex or simple as you want.
- Fantastic online community that is always ready to help

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?

The biggest challenge I have with the application is the fact that it is not HIPAA compliant at this time. I believe Eloqua/Oracle is working on getting the application up to par with HIPAA regulations.

I get to make my internal customers happy and deliver communications to our multiple audiences in a snap.

- Consistency of communications with brand alignment

all_reviews.review_content:

Eloqua can do a whole lot. From lead management, lead routing, lead scoring, to campaign management and email marketing.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The UI is very old and not user friendly. It takes a long time to master and get use to the UI. Dynamic content is not as powerful as other systems. No easy way to A/B test emails. Only 15 filters when creating segmented lists.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
One of the top marketing automation solutions that's worth a look.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Needed a marketing automation solution to handle all lead management for our sales and marketing teams. It has done its job but it required a lot of manpower and work to get it up and running.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is a feature rich marketing automation tool that is infinitely powerful and easy to support.  We are never limited by what the software cannot do.  Instead, we are prevents by our lack of creativity and marketing acumen.  We have used it to create an ecosystem of marketing messages based upon interaction with our company, score and route leads based upon customized criteria, and have found success in all areas of our business.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
This is a very small complaint, but it is hard to send notifications to sales.  Often times we want to notify them of campaign response or activity.  I've created a work around, but it would be nice if it was easier to do.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
We've used several other companies in this space.  Eloqua is by far the best.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eloqua allows us to score every lead that comes through our system.  Priority leads are sent to sales, while other leads are nurtured.  This has created more efficiency in our sales department as they are not constantly looking for leads.

It has also allowed us to send timely and targeted messages based upon interaction with our site.  This has increased customer loyalty as we are sending valuable information.

Eloqua has replaced several of our vendors because it is so powerful.  It goes way beyond email.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful application with an even more powerful community
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua is and always has been the premium product for Marketing Automation. That said, it hasn't gone to their head and made them complacent. They consistently innovate and release new features to the user base targeted to the ways in which our business environments are changing. On top of this, their online and offline communities are top-notch. I always find the support I need either within or without the Eloqua employee base and my ability to continue to grow my career and network has been strongly influenced by the things that Eloqua has done.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Many MAP (Marketing Automation Platforms) not just Eloqua claim "closed loop reporting" when in actuality it isn't truly closing any loops. These tools are getting much better at bringing your MAP and CRM together but the real trick is to tie this in with your ERP system, at which point the loop would be closed.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Eloqua is a great, full-featured, premium product. There are a lot of features and support to get you going, and their community it top-notch. Before buying, go to topliners.eloqua.com to hear more from the actual users and see their passion at work. From there you'll get a much better idea of whether or not this is the tool for your application.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Director, Sales Operations and Marketing Automation

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua 9 Power User in the daily grind.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
What I like best is Eloqua's power. We have a fairly large database (over 3 million) and Eloqua is able with the use of Filters and Groups create Distribution Lists. This does a great job in segmenting the database very efficiently that would take weeks if not months otherwise. Eloqua 9 also has what is called Program Builder where you can create a vast array of drip/nurture campaigns, lead scoring, etc.. The have a whole suite of pre-canned and customizable reports that you can create and send.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I've had the chance to preview Eloqua 10 and E9 is just less graphically appealing. I find the Filters can be a little lacking compared to Marketo's Smart Lists (which I've used as well). My guess is any new customers of Eloqua will be pointed towards E10 say my complaints may not even apply but they are very minor considering what you get in return.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would definitely recommend Eloqua for anyone looking into a very robust, powerful marketing automation system. As others have mentioned if you're looking to just email than this will be overkill but if you're wanting to take your marketing to the next level than Eloqua is for you.

As others have mentioned if you're looking to just email than this will be overkill but if you're wanting to take your marketing to the next level than Eloqua is for you.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The interface to build campaigns is very intuitive and simple, yet ready for large enterprises.  The Campaign Canvas allows marketers to think like marketers, and it provides shortcuts to manage all of the campaign-related assets, whether they are a one-time or multiple use.  With a limited amount of training, I was able to create a moderately-complex campaign.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I would love to see some of the "Eloqua 9" (legacy interface) updated to match Eloqua 10.  The majority of the functions a marketer needs are handled in the Campaign Canvas, which is beautiful, but for some of the integration work and program builder, the old interface can get in the way.  This would be a very nice to have, but nothing is "broken" about it.  I would recommend Oracle address this as a medium priority in the Eloqua road map.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have not realized "green dollar" benefits yet, but anticipate higher lead closure rates due to improved nurturing. The "blue dollar" benefits we've seen is a better understanding of our sales and marketing funnel.  We are a very small organization, but the conversation between sales functions and marketing functions is clarifying; responsibility for the customer is more shared and socialized than ever, and this is a good (blue dollar!) feeling.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The Eloqua platform is intuitive and easy to use with a strong community of users and partners that can help you to deliver significant business benefits with relative ease

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Since Eloqua was acquired by Oracle the Eloqua team has grown significantly and there are now so many people that sometimes it's less clear who to contact

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Eloqua is a strong product that can dramatically assist you with your marketing.  It is supported by an extensive community of marketeers who are happy to help you and a strong partner network who will help you achieve the smallest challenge or build super advanced CRM programmes.  Eloqua also have a wealth of expertise that they will happily share to support your success.  The combination of these this is extremely powerful.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Key challenges that Eloqua has helped to solve: Driving marketing efficiency, driving marketing effectiveness, measuring the contribution that marketing delivers, identifying which campaign strands are adding the most value, enabling our sales team. So far we managed to drive multi-million euro sales that were incremental to a control group, we managed to significantly reduce the amount of time and resource it takes to build campaigns, we were able to automate reports to key stakeholders, we could identify where in the buying cycle a prospect or customer is at any one time, we could see the sales generated from our activities and we could drive efficiencies in our sales team, helping to drive the business forward and bring sales and marketing teams closer together

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful system with great features; latest version is a slight step backwards
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
* Eloqua is a robust system that can handle a huge contact base.
* Allows automation of almost any process, from emails to landing page submission to tracking contact activity in Salesforce.
* The Eloqua user community (called Topliners) is lively and helpful.
* Integration with Salesforce works well (though it takes a lot of setup).
* App plug-ins (called Cloud Connectors) to extend functionality even further.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
* Lost functionality in E10 (newest version) -- some of the more complicated tasks in E9 have been dumbed down in the service of making the interface more user-friendly. Several out-of-the-box reports are no longer available.
* Technical Support can be hit-or-miss; online documentation seems to have decreased in favor of pointing people to the online community for answers.
* Use of email address at the primary contact database key leads to some complicated work-arounds for us.
* E10 is buggy compared to E9, despite having been out for more than a year.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
* Decide what you need out of a marketing automation system. If you're just sending emails and logging recipients, Eloqua would be overkill. If you want to do lead scoring, campaign automation, etc., then you should consider Eloqua.
* Have dedicated resources (both time and money) for post-launch. A healthy system requires at least one full-time admin, and I would suggest a few training licenses for power-users.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful platform but lacking with some simple functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I absolutely love campaign canvas. The automated programs that I am able to accomplish with it makes me look like a genius to my marketing department. The user interface is very good and cues should be applied to the rest of the platform.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I dislike several bugs that make accomplishing simple tasks much more tedious and time consuming. Why can't multiple items be moved at once in the file explorer? Why can't multiple items in segments be merged in one step? There are plenty more small annoyances but those would be at the top of my list. Support is also hit or miss...usually miss, unfortunately based on my experience.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
I would recommend Eloqua to anyone looking to create automated campaigns on a regular basis, to those looking for powerful segmentation tools, or those who aim to have a clean database.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am solving the problem of not enough time to do what is required. Automated campaigns saves our team hours upon hours which is fantastic.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful. Moderate Learning Curve. Active User Community.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The interface and methodology is very sound. The user community is very vocal and well supported by the Eloqua team. There is a genuine interest by Eloqua team members in your success. Nearly plug and play integration with Salesforce.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Oracle acquisition led to to a fall off in the customer experience. Custom integrations can be difficult and documentation and support can be lacking. Topliners (community site) is relied on a little too much. The pricing structure (Oracle) will Eloqua more expensive to use.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Conduct a proper due diligence analysis. Eloqua may be overkill for current needs. Also, if you are NOT a Salesforce user, be absolutely sure you understand everything that is involved with custom CRM integrations.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead generation and lead optimization.  Eloqua system has encouraged our marketing teams to embrace email marketing as the go-to channel to get our offers and thought leadership communicated to our prospects and customers.

review_question_answers.answer: Conduct a proper due diligence analysis. Eloqua may be overkill for current needs. Also, if you are NOT a Salesforce user, be absolutely sure you understand everything that is involved with custom CRM integrations.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Top Notch Marketing Automation & Highly Engaged Community !
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
~ Highly flexible marketing automation capabilities (With custom objects, integrations with other databases via SFTP etc., web/online abilities)
~ Robust CRM Integration
~ Ease of use for a non-technical Marketer
~ Availability of several cloud connector apps
~ Training and recorded guidance sessions - Eloqua University
~ Last but definitely one key element - the "Topliners" Community

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
~ Reporting is a challenge, just like any other Marketing Automation Platform
~ Some bugs can be frustrating at times (Especially on E9)

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
It would make it easier if one understands their business and requirements before zeroing on a platform. Eloqua is great with on boarding and has an amazing support system. Also, make sure you are active on the Topliners community, which is a one-stop resource shop for Eloqua.

I would definitely recommend Eloqua to fellow Modern Marketers. I have used it at 2 companies for almost 3 years now. It is getting better with every release. I get excited when they have their release announcements. Definitely a market leader in the Marketing Automation Space.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua, a solution every Marketer should use!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua can support a marketer on every digital aspect of campaigning and it is really designed to support the customer decision journey and to drive lead management within the organization.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
After a release it can still have a number of bugs.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Start simple and first begin with establishing the buy-in with Marketing and Sales. They need to start thinking differently when they want to use the full potential of Eloqua. Once this buy-in is established, start with simple campaigns and newsletters. When you have mastered Eloqua as a toll, start the integration with CRM/Sales and after that go for the more complex leadnurture campaigns and scoring.

Most of all have fun with Marketing and start experimenting different tactics!!!.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating one central database, not only with customer master data, but also the digital body language. Enabling one-to-one communication with clients on all digital touch points and being able to integrate also offline touch points.

Having Eloqua implemented also drives change in the Marketing organization to start thinking from a persona and journey perspective and move away from Batch and blast.

Finally the way leadscoring can be applied to "steer" your sales funnel is excellent as it provides the power to Marketing to help sales close their deals more effectively

all_reviews.review_title: Great MAP that continues to get better with each major release.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
E10 interface, the campaign canvass and advanced lead scoring module plus the wealth of apps on the Eloqua App Cloud make Eloqua a modern marketers best weapon to score and nurture leads and deliver topline revenue to their organization. I also love the online community Topliners where other users can connect and solve problems without calling support and share new ideas to improve efforts!

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
The training is pretty time consuming but once you get past it you're good to go. Account service fell off the radar during the acquisition by Oracle but finally is back to where I expect it as a long time customer.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Make sure to talk with at least 3 existing customers who are similar to you and your company/organization. Especially recommend those who have switched from other platforms like Marketo.  Also look at analyst reports to help you make a decision and make sure to include your Salesforce.com or CRM admin in your evaluation!

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is the most robust marketing automation platform with the least amount of limitations.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Their customer community is second to none. They actually take the top three spots. I've used a couple other platforms and in no other user community are customers and employees more willing to volunteer their expertise to help solve your problems.

They also have an easy to manage CRM integration for SFDC, can automation almost any marketing process, and have an amazing portfolio of 3rd party cloud integrators for those special projects.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
They can sometimes be a little buggy. The platform has never failed on me in a way that affects my campaigns, but for example one of the search bars acted funky when you typed in it or you would have to click into something twice to get it to select. The good thing is that they solve these issue fairly quickly and they never affect my marketing efforts.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
If you want a stable, robust, easy to use, marketing automation platform with an incredibly helpful user community full of experts willing to help out at a moment's notice, Eloqua is for you.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua: A very robust tool that can bring your Marketing department to the next level.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua makes automation of email marketing super easy. It collects so much information on the back end that you can use to create reports. It also allows for deep segmentation of your database to send the proper message to the proper people.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Sometimes I find certain tasks just difficult to complete. There is usually a round-about way to get there, but it can usually be done. I also wish the setup section got  a bit of face lift when E10 was rolled out.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Implement this tool thoughtfully and with intent. As with anything you put in what you get out. Because Eloqua is so robust, you will want to take advantage of all the tools available in the most appropriate way possible.

What problems is Oracle Eloqua solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are integrating with our non-standard CRM more and more. This has allowed for better Marketing and Sales alignment. It has brought our team closer together and have them wanting more. It also lets us see a different level of metrics than what we could see simply from our CRM.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
We reviewed a number of marketing automation platforms before choosing Eloqua.  Eloqua offered the most functionality and was clearly the easiest to use.  Another big factor was integration with our ERP system.  Most other platforms required Salesforce, Microsoft, etc. in order to fully integrate.  Since we don't use a standard CRM, it would have been extremely difficult for us to connect with Marketo and others.  Eloqua made it simple and straightforward.  Another huge advantage is Eloqua's education and community.  They are second to none.  Between their University courses, Masters programs, Smart Start, and Success Coach program, you are setup for success right from the beginning.  Eloqua's relationship with you does not end once you sign the agreement... it is just beginning.  It is truly an amazing group.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
My biggest issue with Eloqua, and marketing automation in general, is that closed loop reporting isn't truly available unless you are using Salesforce or the like.  I also wish there was a way to create customized reports using data cards without the need for an additional Analyzer license.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
If you are considering a marketing automation platform, I would absolutely recommend Eloqua.  To me, the most important factor to success is knowledge and support.  Eloqua has this in abundance.  Their Topliners community is outstanding.  You will not be disappointed.

Since we don't use a standard CRM, it would have been extremely difficult for us to connect with Marketo and others.  Eloqua made it simple and straightforward.  Another huge advantage is Eloqua's education and community.  They are second to none.  Between their University courses, Masters programs, Smart Start, and Success Coach program, you are setup for success right from the beginning.  Eloqua's relationship with you does not end once you sign the agreement... it is just beginning.  It is truly an amazing group.

My experience with Eloqua thus far has been a "if you dream it, you can build it" type experience. Rarely have I come across a scenario we haven't been able to set up & run in Eloqua. As I begin an install with a new company, I'm also excited to use the reporting and salesforce integration functions to their fullest.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
E10 UI is a bit wonky at times. Too many clicks to get from point A to point B and not as intuitive as I'd have hoped, though I know some specific improvements are on the horizon.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Not sure? Join Topliners (http://topliners.com/welcome). Sift through the discussions. You'll see the power of the program and also of the community of users. Very easy to find support from others problem solving like you.

all_reviews.review_title: Very Powerful Product but steep learning curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
First and foremost,I love the Eloqua staff. Everyone I have ever worked with at Eloqua represents the company well and is service and quality minded.

Secondly, I appreciate the power and capability of Eloqua, but sometimes it is hard given my schedule for deliverables to utilize those capabilities.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I appreciate the power and capability of Eloqua, but sometimes it is hard given my schedule for deliverables to utilize those capabilities.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Please understand that when I answer n/a it is either because we don't use that functionality or because another team implemented Eloqua so I just don't know the answer.

Document, document, document. I inherited the system from someone else and there was little to no documentation regarding implementation. While this may take more time it will save lots of time in the future as new people join your Eloqua users team. .

Also, make sure you have standards from the very beginning. Standards regarding such things as naming conventions, best practices, etc.

- Integration with Salesforce is fantastic, native experience and works very well.
- Database scales very well, we have over 600,000 contacts without any challenges.
- Email deploys and deliverability are very strong.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Principal Product Manager with Oracle | Eloqua

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua's way to set-up marketing processes that are transparent to the sales force, easy to understand once set up to marketers, and complex enough for process lovers such as workflow masters, BPM engineers, etc.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Sometimes Eloqua is not as intelligent as it's marketed. Applying filters that effectively deliver healthy leads to the sales force can be tricky as the system is not really intelligent, it merely reads it's configuration and filters things out. If you want more power than that, not even the top programmer can make it happen.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
All in all, Eloqua is more effective when people do their jobs right: mkt operations people need to set it up; marketers need to fill up content and launch campaigns; sales reps need to feed the CRM that continually updates Eloqua. Behavior is not that easy to program when most customers will opt-out or when there is still people walking-in into your events uninvited, so you need everyone to cooperate.

Eloqua is as good as the information you drop into it so beware newbies, if your operation is not big enough you may feel swamped before you even start.

all_reviews.review_title: The Marketing Automation Platform That Has It All
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
In Eloqua 10, the split screen HTML editor allows you to edit the emails almost as if you were using Dreamweaver. The reporting tool, Insight, is a great improvement and provides me with the metrics I need to present to management quickly and easily. With Campaign Canvas for event follow-ups and Program Builder for more complex nurture campaigns, all your bases are covered regarding email.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua can have some bugs. Firefox is the approved browser, but I was told for some actions to use IE instead to avoid glitches.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
When I reviewed a variety of marketing automation vendors a couple of years ago for a small company, Eloqua was not on the list due to price. As others have mentioned here, you absolutely need someone dedicated to email marketing to make Eloqua work. You should review all the features that Eloqua offers and determine if you will use most of them or not. If you just need to send basic company emails, go with something cheaper. If you need to create a nurture program that sends a different emails every 3 weeks based on location, industry, whether the contact has been moved to an opportunity in your CRM and has taken an action with your last email, then it doesn't get better than Eloqua.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use product with excellent start ups
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The on boarding is brilliant, from the day we signed we were constantly kept in the loop of the next steps we should take, arranging a Smart Start program where we are assisted with the set up of the product. Eloqua University is also a great addition, there are many instructor led classes which are easy to watch and easy to follow which really provide great content.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There are a few features we require that aren't currently in the product, however these are on the road map and are scheduled for later this year.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Sign up to topliners, it's a great Eloqua community and they will certainly help you with any queries they have. Also, try arranging a demo, seeing the product really shows the power it has.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The things I liked best about Eloqua were available in Eloqua 9. I loved form processing steps and the flexibility they gave. I liked program builder and the complex/sophisticated programs you could dream up and build. I fell in love with Marketing Automation when I was an Eloqua 9 user and I will always have a soft-spot in my heart for the platform. The Eloqua 10 campaign canvas is good. It's easy to visualize what's happening, but when I was using it there were some real problems with campaign feeders, campaign association, getting people out of campaigns, etc. Eloqua 10 looks good and sexy, but a lot of the basic and useful functionality that I loved about E9 is missing. The new reporting feature in E10 is pretty amazing as well.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
My upgrade from Eloqua 9 to Eloqua 10 caused us to switch to Marketo (I'm now a Marketo lover). I didn't know what I was missing, but I'll save that for the Marketo review. First the things I disliked about Eloqua 9: Complicated to use, especially for my non-system loving marketing managers. If you weren't a power user, you couldn't use E9. The time delay for lead insertion into Salesforce was a major problem for us. It could take up too 6 hours. Our upgrade from E9 to E10 was a complete disaster. Because E10 doesn't use the prospects table and one of my CRM integration programs referenced the prospects table for super region assignment (this was identified as known and acceptable by the upgrade team), none of my net-new leads would submit to salesforce. It took us nearly 8 weeks and about $5K in consulting services hours (I couldn't get the attention of anyone at Eloqua to solve the problem, so I had to hire a consulting firm) to isolate the issue. For 8 weeks I had to manually update leads to Salesforce. The lack of support (even after escalating all the way to the executive level) did nothing to motivate the support or upgrade teams to solve my issue. The problem I described was the most dramatic impact, but we had several others (including ruining 6-months of campaign data in salesforce).

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Eloqua is a powerful automation tool, but even with Eloqua 10 it is more complicated to use than some of the other tools. Customer Success doesn't seem to be a priority and you'll most likely need to hire a consulting firm to provide ongoing support/maintenance (we had a consulting firm on monthly retainer). Now that Eloqua is an Oracle company, I would be cautious about choosing them if you're using Salesforce for CRM.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Quantitative Database and Analytics Lead - Marketing Operations Manager

all_reviews.review_title: Efficient Workflow and Flexible Features Make Eloqua my Preferred MA System
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
As someone who creates hundreds of campaigns each year, I like a system that doesn't limit me and provides a smooth workflow across all key elements (email, landing pages, campaign logic, filtering, and reporting). Eloqua saves me time, makes me more productive, and has the flexibility to get the results you want with the least amount of effort.

Workflow - sometimes its the simple things that make you most productive. Take Eloqua's Email Import Wizard, for example. You create an email and import it into Eloqua and it recognizes the images on import. 'Big deal' you say. After hunting down images for about 30 emails you'll wish you had this feature in other MA solutions.

Search is another area that I find much better than other comparable solutions. For example, I can search for the items I've created as opposed to having to memorize the names of assets of created. Again a time saver.

Campaign workflow is an area that is a combination of easy and powerful. You can intuitively drag and drop flows in a way that makes sense.

Are you getting into Content Marketing? Then you'll love page tags. This is your ability to group like pages by subject. You can use these groupings in your logic to figure out what campaigns your users should receive, lead score, etc.

Do you have vendors you already work with that you want to integrate with Eloqua? The appcloud is indispensable and easy to use - no need for APIs or other custom work. Just answer a couple of questions and you're integrated.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
I don't have any major complaints at this time.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Like all MA solutions, know what you need - the types of campaigns you will run and overall flow of your marketing. Unlike some other MA vendors, Eloqua has an open online community filled with other marketers willing to share their experience. Take advantage of this transparency and knowledge.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool especially for the experienced marketer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Great functionality overall. It is a very robust tool. Has a ton of options for creating rules, routing and overall nurturing programs. I am a big fan of the new interface. It is much more user friendly experience.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Very few things that I dislike about Eloqua, because I believe it is one of the most superior tools on the market. My one issue is around some of the interface design for the HTML design and it's inability for editing html directly. As a former designer, I'm not a fan of learning a different way to design landing pages and html pages. I prefer the old fashion, html and design option.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Absolutely, I would recommend it, but not for everyone. This product requires a good amount of skills around marketing automation. It is not a product for someone starting in marketing automation.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Manager Sales Enablement and Customer Engagement

all_reviews.review_title: Packed with features; massive potential for specialist Marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua's Salesforce.com integration capability, flexibility and ease of use; The myriad of data tools available to support better management and enhancement of data; The growing App Cloud increasing functionality rapidly via other third party solution providers - particularly the event solutions; Custom data object capability; Eloqua's online resource and community - Topliners; Overall, power and potential of the platform.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
No major gripes but some legacy features would be a welcome return, albeit in a revamped state - such as the asset library enabling content sharing (SmartExchange).

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Invest time up front in understanding the technical capabilities of the platform; don't overlook things like scoring, CRM integration, process definition etc. in order to rush ahead with campaign launches - getting these bits right will determine your success; Spend time working with all relevant stakeholders to agree how technology might optimise existing marketing - sales process and secure buy-in from all parties. Don't underestimate the work needed to bring all of the moving parts together but equally, don't be overwhelmed. There are lots of experts out there, accessible via Topliners - the online community - and a large and varied partner network.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?

You will never run into limitations with Eloqua. Their staff is amazing and bend over backward to help you out in any way. Using Eloqua has revolutionized the marketing department for our company

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There is a bit of a learning curve with any marketing automation platform. I will never feel like I have mastered Eloqua...but speaks more to my limited brain and Eloqua's limitless potential.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Marketing Tool.  Let's Hope Oracle Allows it Continue on its Current Path
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
This is a powerful marketing automation tool with a lot of options and features - more than its competitors in most areas.  It also has extremely powerful workflow functionality.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Just like any software tool with a variety of options and features, it can be a bit cumbersome to use at times and the learning curve for new users with no prior exposure to it can be a little high.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
For me, the biggest question mark right now is centered around what's going to happen to Eloqua now that it's been acquired by Oracle and to what extent they plan to integrate it into their existing set of tools.  In its current state, I would definitely recommend it, but it would also be understandable to want to wait on the sidelines for a little while and see how its development roadmap starts to shape up.

review_question_answers.answer: For me, the biggest question mark right now is centered around what's going to happen to Eloqua now that it's been acquired by Oracle and to what extent they plan to integrate it into their existing set of tools.  In its current state, I would definitely recommend it, but it would also be understandable to want to wait on the sidelines for a little while and see how its development roadmap starts to shape up.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is a great marketing tool, but you need to ask any vendor a few hard questions first
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Ease of use. Uploading HTML files and attaching to specific contact groups. Eloqua has a well engineered contact washing machine to help place contacts in the appropriate buckets.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
No integrated deliverability reports, i.e. spam checkers by Postini or Spam Assassin etc.
No integrated operating system reports. i.e. has your message been viewed in an iOS? Android? Blackberry? Windows Outlook? etc?
Are they preparing for the mobile marketing world in E10?

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Build your current processes and operations planning 'before' you jump on the marketing automation bandwagon and be prepared to ask the hard questions. Show the vendors what your future vision is and see if they can deliver - or - if more customization is required for your field mapping and data management practices. Every automation vendor can deliver pretty much the same features. But showing them a lead flow diagram and how you want your automation tool to work will put them on the spot. Every organization has different lead generation needs and different CRM practices.

all_reviews.review_title: The Very Best Marketing Automation Tool on the Market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I have been using Eloqua for the past 1 1/2 years and love it! We are a small business in the B2B market, and this tool has given us the freedom and implement complex marketing automation campaigns across all facets of our business, using simple drag-and-drop methodology. Without Eloqua, we'd still be stuck in the batch-and-blast era of email marketing.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
There's very little to dislike about Eloqua. I have not run into any major disadvantages of the tool. I just wish I had more time to devote to implementing all of the great tools they provide.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Definitely do your research. Know what you are trying to accomplish before going out and buying the first tool you come across. We had extensive business cases drawn out before going with Eloqua. I think this really helped us to make the most of it.

- Excellent work flow management
- Great CRM Integration
- Custom Data Objects
- Great Cloud Connectors (APIs)

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
- Still a little buggy
- Reporting could be better
- Learning curve is slower/longer than competitors

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
My recommendation is to speak to others that have used it for a period of time, if you a business looking to deploy it internally - make sure you have the resource and skill sets internally to support it.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
I love that this product will allow you to automate, market, track, and report on just about any digital format.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
That it has a learning steep learning curb to really tie together you all you needs into an automation.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Make sure you have a very passionate marketing person being trained on the power of this product and then make sure you can hang onto them as they will be in demand. Eloqua has power like non of the other platforms on the market but if you want it to do it all then be prepared it will take a while to strategically implement. For now you can get the basic up and running fairly easy.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Marketing Automation Tool That Drives Results
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
The Salesforce integration is very clean.  Email functionality and tracking click throughs has played major benefits for us in target marketing campaigns.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Only wierd thing is that we had to recreate our Opportunity page witha Visual Force page (Consultant did this) .. not sure why though.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Worth a try ... just try it out, you won't be disappointed.

all_reviews.review_title: Eloqua is top notch for Marketing Automation and Demand Gen.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
Eloqua provides an unparalleled platform of functionality marketers need to automate & measure demand generation campaigns that generate more high-quality leads.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Would love to see bundled pricing for multi-year engagement contracts.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Do your research but I think you will find that Eloqua provides the most robust reporting and tracking features of all the platforms on the market today.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Oracle Eloqua?
As the title says, it was a simple installation and easy to get up and running out of the box.  Integration into SFDC is also made very easy.

What do you dislike about Oracle Eloqua?
Customizing eloqua would require us to involve a 3rd party, it is not as straightforward, or simple as one would like.

Recommendations to others considering Oracle Eloqua:
Eloqua is a simple tool to get started with, and really will not require much customization, but you will more than likely need assistance to get any customization made.
